Job Title: Vice President of Customer Services EMEA
Description:
The Vice President of Customer Services EMEA is a key leadership stakeholder in Dematic’s success in the marketplace. Most specifically, this person will be responsible for leading the company’s Power with Services Strategy to further cement Dematic’s position as the market leader in this industry. 



The role will have responsibilities spanning from defining customer requirements through to the provision of Dematic’s modernization and upgrade services. Success in this role will be measured by the ability to increase customer satisfaction while expanding Dematic’s service offering while maintaining profitability. 



As Dematic’s VP of Customer Service, you will be responsible for a team of approximately 1,000 employees from installation and application engineers to sales account managers supporting the EMEA market.


About Dematic: 



Dematic is a global leader in intelligent intralogistics and material handling solutions. With a rich history of innovation and a commitment to excellence, we provide cutting-edge technology and expertise to optimize our clients' supply chains. We offer an inclusive and collaborative work environment where employees can thrive and make a meaningful impact.
Tasks and Qualifications:


Key Responsibilities:



Lead the strategic pillar of Power with Services to drive growth that outpaces the market.
Accountable for Order Income, Sales, and Margins Budget target achievement.
Provide leadership to and develop strategies for the Customer Service organization in alignment with the Company's mission statement and strategic plan.
Manage by designing/ implementing processes that provide a high level of customer satisfaction at projected target margins.
Effectively build a culture that fosters teamwork and cooperation to improve efficiency and synergy to reduce waste/cost.
Create/conceptualize new systems, strategies, and programs with significant business impact.
Successfully defines workflows, jobs, and reporting relationships to obtain optimum effectiveness.
Attracting, developing, motivating, and managing, highly trained technical professionals to ensure an effective workforce capable of meeting all stated business objectives.


Qualifications & Experience:



A degree-educated professional with expertise and experience leading large-scale project-based organizations with established service models for their customers.
Strong communication skills and leverage those skills to build relationships with customers and internal stakeholders.
Ability to work in a high-growth environment with demanding deadlines.
Demonstrate experience successfully leading large, diverse, and multinational diverse teams.
A strong financial acumen and previous experience managing a P&L would be advantageous in this position.
An agent of change with demonstrable experience in driving and managing change within an organization.
Demonstrate outstanding team-building skills with the ability to improve interaction and efficiency as well as the ability to break down barriers.
Experience in the analysis of performance metrics: short- and long-term technology development planning, evaluation, testing, and selection.
Experience with workforce planning, recruiting, and budgeting/forecasting.
Demonstrated success in lead generation.
Existing technical experience and knowledge of the material handling industry, supply chain design, or material handling is a plus.
Fluent in English and willing to travel approximately 60% of the time.


Professional & Personal Competencies:



Setting Strategy: The capacity to craft an inspiring vision for the entire organization, fostering innovation and creativity to push boundaries, and the skill to balance the aspiration for change with a realistic understanding of organizational capacity, ensuring the creation of attainable and successful goals and implementation plans.
Executing for Results: Setting challenging yet clear goals and being unwavering in delivering results, adept at navigating ambiguity and guiding others through complexity, willing to take calculated risks while considering input and potential consequences, and maintaining a reputation for integrity, foresight, transparency, and a steadfast commitment to the organization's best interests.
Leading Teams: Excels in recruiting top talent, motivating, delegating, fostering diversity, and managing performance while nurturing the team's growth. They demonstrate unwavering persistence and an unyielding dedication to high standards, earning the respect of their followers. Furthermore, they embrace self-reflection and personal growth, setting an example for continuous improvement and maintaining an open and feedback-oriented approach to drive organizational performance.
Relationships and Influence: Innate relationship-building skills, marked by high emotional intelligence and effective communication. They inspire trust and followership through compelling influence, charismatic leadership, passionate beliefs, and active drive. Furthermore, they encourage a collaborative atmosphere, celebrate team success, and instil a sense of purpose that extends beyond their personality, engaging the team in a broader organizational mission.

Dematic is looking for a Procurement Projects Lead to join our team in France. This highly visible Procurement Projects Lead role is accountable to collaborate with Procurement Regional Category Leads, Project Management, Engineering, Solutions Development, Finance, A/P, Quality and others to develop, communicate and execute world class strategies for projects that deliver the project on time, mitigate risk, ensure top line growth and drive bottom line savings. This is an exciting opportunity for a seasoned Procurement professional to take on large spend for a key customer within our growing organization, while positioning us for future success.


The opportunity to work with a world leading supplier of supply chain solutions
An international team
Opportunities for growth that match your skills and ambition
Flexible working hours
The ability to work from home
No two projects are ever the same!


Responsibilities:

Attend weekly project management meetings to fully understand project scope, Resale content with ‘as-is’ risks and installation schedules with critical milestones
Work with sourcing Category teams to identify qualified sources of Resale equipment to develop the Project sourcing plan.
Prepare Resale project requirements content sheet for Category teams to populate project sourcing plan
Communicate supplier lead times to develop equipment ‘drop-dead’ order dates to ensure equipment is ordered with sufficient time to enable on-time supplier deliveries to project schedule
Maintain supplier delivery date schedule
Attend Gate review meetings and alert team on any resale-related issues
Conduct supplier gate reviews (based on content/risk) with key/critical suppliers per check-list
Track negotiated resale savings (net of increases) to determine Procurement savings – this includes comparing “as-sold” Resale content budget compared to resale purchase actuals. Work with Project Finance for alignment.
Perform as the main Procurement liaison between Project Management and Engineering for project related activity.
Conduct post-project reviews with the Project Team and develop pro-active solutions to supplier related concerns for future projects.
Align with Regional Program Management project support structure, as well as large customer accounts


Bachelor's degree in business, engineering or related discipline.
Certified Professional Supply Management (CPSM) preferred and/or Project Management Professional (PMP) preferred
3-5 years of relevant project-based Procurement experience
Strong communication and presentation skills
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in procurement processes
Experience with SAP and MS Office
Able to be effective in a remote, global, and matrixed environment.

ematic is an intralogistics innovator who designs, builds, and supports intelligent, automated solutions for manufacturing, warehouse, and distribution environments for customers that are powering the future of commerce. With engineering centers, manufacturing facilities, and service centers located in more than 25 countries, the Dematic global network of 10,000 employees has helped achieve more than 6,000 worldwide customer installations for some of the world’s leading brands. Dematic provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

The base pay range for this role is estimated to be $65,000-$140,000 at the time of posting. Final compensation will be determined by various factors such as work location, education, experience, knowledge, and skills.

Tasks and Qualifications:

What you will do in this role:

Own, document, communicate, and gain buy-in for category strategies for spend under management
Research, select, develop, and maintain adequate sources of supply to ensure the requirements of the categories are met with optimum quality, service, and cost to use
Ability to negotiate with suppliers successfully by:
Analyzing the market and supply dynamics
Develop counterarguments, opening positions, and negotiation sourcing plans to prepare for multiple negotiation scenarios
Align on acceptable negotiation outcomes by engaging internal stakeholders
Lead the development of risk analyses, assessments, and mitigation plans for categories of spend to proactively protect against supply interruptions
Develop and execute plans to quickly and effectively react to unforeseen supply interruptions
Comprehend and provide constructive input on legal contract documents related to business Terms & Conditions, pricing, delivery, etc.
Utilize financial acumen to develop cost models/should cost analysis and thoroughly understand key market drivers and how they affect price, availability, or supply chain logistics
Negotiate competitive master supply agreements and pricing models to ensure competitive supply supporting business margin targets
Ensure actual pricing is consistent with master supply agreements and price models
Develop and maintain a robust cost-savings project pipeline and project-managed initiatives until successful implementation
Actively pursue internal “voice-of-customer” and ensure perspectives are addressed in category approaches
Ensure a competitive supplier panel (including sole/single source mitigation) is developed to support high business growth rates
Monitor supplier financial risk and take business-protecting proactive actions
Conduct supplier business reviews with forward-leaning agendas: technology, collaboration, and overall competitiveness

What we are looking for:

Bachelor's degree in business, supply chain management, engineering or a related discipline
5+ years of relevant Procurement experience with an emphasis on category management 
Certified Professional Supply Management (CPSM) (preferred)
Procurement experience with sourcing categories assigned
Strong leadership qualities with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication and presentation skills
Strong data analysis skills
Operates with minimal business direction
Driving business results through business case development, influence, and leadership
Strong capabilities in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and SAP
Embodies KION Group Values of Integrity, Collaboration, Courage, and Excellence.
Travel as required by the job, estimated to be up to 25%
Operate with a sense of business urgency


This position is eligible to be fully remote.

The NA Commercial Data Analyst supports Dematic’s NA Sales Operations & Strategy organization through the standardization of processes and development of complex data analysis tools to monitor sales performance and identify areas of growth. A passionate data analyst with sound understanding on how the business functions operates a working knowledge of data sets, geared towards building process excellence and analytical processes and tools to support the growing analytical needs of the NA Sales Operations & Strategy team. Working closely with key stakeholders and analysts on our NA Sales business tools is critical to drive global alignment of data, processes, and provide analytics to enable strategic and tactical business decisions. The ideal candidate will have the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that aligns and improves NA processes and reporting. This position will work closely with all Regional and Global analysts and SMEs from Commercial Finance, IT, and Salesforce to define and help implement best practices.

Tasks and Qualifications:

What You Will Do In This Role:

Partner cross-functionally to develop, modify, and distribute standard and ad hoc management reports/dashboards which provide actionable data; includes leading and lagging indicators of success.
Work closely with Global Commercial Operations; primarily related (but not limited to) Electronic Data Warehouse (EDW), Salesforce.com data governance, SAP S/4HANA sales process & master data, Salesforce alignments, dashboards, ad-hoc analysis and reporting.
Provide data analysis visuals on Power BI platform to the Global Commercial team on trends, patterns and gaps; leverage data, analytics and technology to propose and implement global solutions.
Identify requirements and create standard work for data governance and NA Sales dashboards.
Work closely with Global/Regional teams to define processes to ensure data quality is maintained at the highest level.
Leverage data from a variety of sources (Snowflake, SFDC, SAP S/4HANA, GDW, etc.) to analyze business performance, identify areas of opportunity and provide actionable insights.
Design, testing, implementation and evaluation of business process changes to improve data quality and business outcomes.

Programming tools, such as SQL, Snowflake, Oracle and Python/R
Working knowledge of BI platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, Salesforce.com and SAP S/4HANA
Experience as a Salesforce administrator or similar CRM is desired
The ability to analyze, model and interpret data
Strong analytical skills and high level of mathematical ability

Self-motivated, customer oriented, team player with ability to manage multiple projects with minimal supervision
Demonstrated experience successfully gather and executing report requirements
4-7 years of experience in business analytics

Job Title: Sr. Director, Global Communications & Brand Leader
Description:
The Global Marketing and Communications team is looking for a high-impact Global Communications & Brand Leader, who is passionate about leading communications and increasing brand identify to our global audience of stakeholders, while supporting leadership with deep communications expertise to drive the communications strategy for Dematic. This is a unique and strategic opportunity to develop and execute the communication and brand strategy necessary to foster an engaging workplace culture. Key focus areas of this role will be to drive a compelling and consistent narrative around enhancing employees’ understanding of the company’s PVM (Purpose, Vision, Mission); implementing a high-impact PR strategy enhancing Dematic’s brand position; further the organization’s culture; and increase engagement with employees. This role will collaborate with functional leaders to support the company’s objectives, increase employee engagement program awareness, lead key strategic proactive communications efforts, and ensure alignment with Dematic business goals and company culture.


Reporting to the VP, Marketing and Communications, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and self-directed, with proven ability to deliver outstanding results in an ambiguous, robust environment. This individual must collaborate effectively across organizational lines to drive impact quickly while operating with the highest levels of integrity and trust. Additionally, this individual must be able to simultaneously manage, coordinate, and execute several complex communications and brand projects within stringent timelines and budget parameters.


The Global Communications & Brand Leader is responsible for building a strategic, distinguished, and highly impactful ecosystem ready to partner and support our customers. To achieve this, this role will commit to Increasing the profitable growth for their partners, helping their businesses transform and be successful, and enhancing their partners’ experience.


What we offer:


What We Offer


 Career Development
 Competitive Compensation and Benefits
 Pay Transparency
 Global Opportunities


Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/


Dematic provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. The base pay range for this role is estimated to be $175,000.00-$250,000.00 at the time of posting. Final compensation will be determined by various factors such as work location, education, experience, knowledge, and skills. 


Tasks and Qualifications:


This is What You Will do in This Role:


Accountable for developing and leading commmunications activities and communications infrastructure that captures, promotes, and protects Dematic’s brand and brand reputation. Responsible for broadening and increasing brand identity and awareness for all relevant stakeholders and target audiences.
Proactively identify business, market or employee engagement challenges and deploy high-impact communications strategies and initiatives to provide sustainable solutions. Develop and implement communications strategies that engage, align, and inspire target audiences. 
Accountable for implementing a high-impact PR strategy, along wtih integrated protocols, activities, and initiatives. Lead program for each Global Leadership Team member to serve as a thought leader in the market, which in turn enhances Dematic’s brand position and attractiveness to talent and customers. 
Responsible for Dematic’s various internal and external communications artifacts and mediums, ensuring integrated content and brand enable the attainment of the organization’s objectives and employee engagement targets. 
Build an open and engaging culture by identifying and implementing communications opportunities to connect leadership with employees to reinforce key messages and build organizational brand loyalty.
Develop and manage the execution of marketing campaigns that drive brand awareness, engagement, and lead generation
Lead Dematic’s Corporate and Community Affairs strategy and execution, ensuring tight alignment with long term enterprise business objectives.
Serve as the direct Communications partner to the SCS CEO and the ELT


What We are Looking For:


Bachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, Journalism or related discipline required. Advanced degree preferred.
10+ years’ experience in a communications leadership capacity, developing and successfully implementing strategic global corporate communications programs.
Demonstrated enterprise experience leading comprehensive strategic corporoate communications, crisis communications, brand, media relations, PR, and employee engagement portfolios of work to advance the organizations’s mission and goal attainment.
Proven experience developing communications strategies and/or initiatives that directly enabled enterprise transformations.
Experience creating effective operating mechanisms and quality controls in order to ensure the consistent, accurate and effective development and delivery of optimal messaging to all relevant audiences. 
Must possess innovative, progressive, creative thinking and the ability to translate ideas into action.
Advanced understanding and application of change management principles and the interconnectivity between change leadership and communications.
Advanced capabilty in message development, narration, storytelling, and creative delivery.
Demonstrated leadership skills including coaching and development of a team of Communications professionals geographically dispersed and with matrixed reporting lines.
Highly engaging executive presence and communication skills in order to effectively influence and cascade key messages through a variety of mediums, including Global Town Halls, KG4+ calls and communications, and other high impact moments.
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time

We are looking for an individual who has experience in enabling, fostering, and mentoring continuous improvement cross-functionally within Dematic. The Continuous Improvement (CI) function improves our culture by implementing an operating system through systems, processes, tools, and behaviors to support both incremental and transformative change. We harness a teach, coach, mentorship model to empower systems and process ownership.


The Manager of Continuous Improvement (CI) will drive a culture of CI, with a standard process and methodology through the coaching and developing of these behaviors throughout the Organization in partnership with the Americas CI initiative. Working closely with their team, this person will execute a continuous improvement strategy, including driving Lean process frameworks, utilizing technology-based tools to drive efficiency, and ensuring all employees are empowered to continuously improve. Job Title: Vice President of Customer Services EMEA
Description:
The Vice President of Customer Services EMEA is a key leadership stakeholder in Dematic’s success in the marketplace. Most specifically, this person will be responsible for leading the company’s Power with Services Strategy to further cement Dematic’s position as the market leader in this industry.

The role will have responsibilities spanning from defining customer requirements through to the provision of Dematic’s modernization and upgrade services. Success in this role will be measured by the ability to increase customer satisfaction while expanding Dematic’s service offering while maintaining profitability.

As Dematic’s VP of Customer Service, you will be responsible for a team of approximately 1,000 employees from installation and application engineers to sales account managers supporting the EMEA market.

What we offer:

About Dematic: 

Dematic is a global leader in intelligent intralogistics and material handling solutions. With a rich history of innovation and a commitment to excellence, we provide cutting-edge technology and expertise to optimize our clients' supply chains. We offer an inclusive and collaborative work environment where employees can thrive and make a meaningful impact.

Tasks and Qualifications:

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the strategic pillar of Power with Services to drive growth that outpaces the market.
Accountable for Order Income, Sales, and Margins Budget target achievement.
Provide leadership to and develop strategies for the Customer Service organization in alignment with the Company's mission statement and strategic plan.
Manage by designing/ implementing processes that provide a high level of customer satisfaction at projected target margins.
Effectively build a culture that fosters teamwork and cooperation to improve efficiency and synergy to reduce waste/cost.
Create/conceptualize new systems, strategies, and programs with significant business impact.
Successfully defines workflows, jobs, and reporting relationships to obtain optimum effectiveness.
Attracting, developing, motivating, and managing, highly trained technical professionals to ensure an effective workforce capable of meeting all stated business objectives.


Qualifications & Experience:

A degree-educated professional with expertise and experience leading large-scale project-based organizations with established service models for their customers.
Strong communication skills and leverage those skills to build relationships with customers and internal stakeholders.
Ability to work in a high-growth environment with demanding deadlines.
Demonstrate experience successfully leading large, diverse, and multinational diverse teams.
A strong financial acumen and previous experience managing a P&L would be advantageous in this position.
An agent of change with demonstrable experience in driving and managing change within an organization.
Demonstrate outstanding team-building skills with the ability to improve interaction and efficiency as well as the ability to break down barriers.
Experience in the analysis of performance metrics: short- and long-term technology development planning, evaluation, testing, and selection.
Experience with workforce planning, recruiting, and budgeting/forecasting.
Demonstrated success in lead generation.
Existing technical experience and knowledge of the material handling industry, supply chain design, or material handling is a plus.
Fluent in English and willing to travel approximately 60% of the time.


Professional & Personal Competencies:

Setting Strategy: The capacity to craft an inspiring vision for the entire organization, fostering innovation and creativity to push boundaries, and the skill to balance the aspiration for change with a realistic understanding of organizational capacity, ensuring the creation of attainable and successful goals and implementation plans.
Executing for Results: Setting challenging yet clear goals and being unwavering in delivering results, adept at navigating ambiguity and guiding others through complexity, willing to take calculated risks while considering input and potential consequences, and maintaining a reputation for integrity, foresight, transparency, and a steadfast commitment to the organization's best interests.
Leading Teams: Excels in recruiting top talent, motivating, delegating, fostering diversity, and managing performance while nurturing the team's growth. They demonstrate unwavering persistence and an unyielding dedication to high standards, earning the respect of their followers. Furthermore, they embrace self-reflection and personal growth, setting an example for continuous improvement and maintaining an open and feedback-oriented approach to drive organizational performance.
Relationships and Influence: Innate relationship-building skills, marked by high emotional intelligence and effective communication. They inspire trust and followership through compelling influence, charismatic leadership, passionate beliefs, and active drive. Furthermore, they encourage a collaborative atmosphere, celebrate team success, and instil a sense of purpose that extends beyond their personality, engaging the team in a broader organizational mission.

Dematic provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. 


 


This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.


The base pay range for this role is estimated to be $28 to $34 an hour at the time of posting. Final compensation will be determined by various factors such as work location, education, experience, knowledge, and skills.


Tasks and Qualifications:


What You Will Do In This Role


Repair and maintenance of Material Handling Equipment (MHE) including belt tracking, component adjustment/replacement, component lubrication, etc. 
Complete preventative maintenance routines, documentation, and procedures. 
Use electrical test equipment to troubleshoot electrical circuitry. 
Create and close work orders into asset management system with appropriate data to include labor hours, equipment maintenance, and parts used. 
Troubleshoot semi-complex problems and understand resources needed to resolve them. 
Locate and track spare parts from inventory. 
Performs routine maintenance and equipment testing to ensure they meet specifications. 
Respond to service calls and correct equipment failures and faults. 
Identify problems as they occur and take appropriate steps to solve them. 
Develop and maintain positive working relationships across all levels of the organizations. 


What We Are Looking For


High School diploma or equivalent required. Typically, an associate degree or vocational technical training is preferred. Specialized skill training/certification preferred. 
2-3 years of troubleshooting electro-mechanical equipment preferred. 
Proven experience in area of responsibility and successful demonstration of position and key responsibilities as presented above. 
Able to lift and move material up to 50 pounds each. 
Regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head. 
Occasionally push and pull wheeled dollies loaded with products up to 100 pounds. 
Able to climb ladders and gangways safely and without limitation. 
Working conditions may include small spaces, dust, fumes/odors, hot/cold temperatures, inside/outside noise, vibration, standing on concrete for long hours and wet or uneven surfaces. 
Must be able to stand/walk for up to 10–12 hours. 
Flexibility in covering multiple shifts and holiday hours as required.

We are seeking a highly organized project scheduler to implement and oversee project schedules. Consulting with project managers and technical experts to set up assignments, tasks, and subtasks.
Developing, implementing, and maintaining an effective scheduling management system.
Coordinating project timelines with internal departments and external stakeholders.
Monitoring project timelines and deadlines.
Identifying potential project schedule delays and facilitating intervention in a timeous manner.
Evaluating performance and preparing project progress reports.
Accommodating updates and changes to project schedules.
Recommending actions to keep projects within budget, and completed on time.
Keeping stakeholders informed of project timelines and deadlines.
Documenting project scheduling processes and maintaining records.


Tasks and Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in project management, or in a related field.
Certification as a PMI scheduling professional (PMI-SP) will be advantageous.
A minimum of two years' experience as a project scheduler in a related industry.
Advanced proficiency in project scheduling software, such as monday.com and MS Projects.
Extensive experience in schedule planning and management.
In-depth knowledge of the scope of projects within the industry.
Advanced ability to evaluate project progress and facilitate interventions.
Ability to keep stakeholders informed of project timelines and changes.
Excellent organizational, time-management, and communication skills.

Dematic is looking for a Operation Supervisor, to be hired with a permanent contract, for its premises in Cernusco sul Naviglio. He/she will be working leading a group of people in order to manage and to control all the resident customer service activities to our Customer distribution Center close to Bologna city.


The Operation Supervisor is going to :

Manage the start-up phase of the project with agile approach
Coordinate a team of +25 workers together with Senior site Manager
Plan and coordinate all on-site activities (preventive/corrective maintenance, spare parts warehouse management, workshop and repair activities) together with Senior site Manager
Design process according with the service contract agreement together with Senior site Manager
Attend planned periodical meetings (daily, weekly, monthly, annual) with internal/external stakeholders
Draft Minute of meeting and site tasks report
Be a key player for the Customer and for Dematic stakeholders.
Manage and prioritize service activities to minimise impact to the customer business
Work with resident team in order to ensure the fully availability of the system under the service contract obligations
Collaborate with other departments interacting continuously with his/her team on the work site
Do periodically KPI analysis and write reports about the service activities
Ensure a safe, secure and clean environment whilst ensuring that the project is delivered within the contractual obligations
Maintain quality control and compliance procedures
Report directly to Senior Site Manager


Who we are looking for?



Curious towards the sector of logistic supply chain and industrial automation
Experience for electrical, mechanical and software engineering
At least 3-5 years of experience in material handling environment e.g. highly automated production plants
Previous experience as Operation Supervisor/Site Supervisor/Site Manager or in a similar role
Previous key role experience in a complex organization 
Bachelor Degree or Technical diploma in Mechanical, Electrical or similar studies
Good knowledge of Italian and English written and spoken


What can we further offer? 


An international environment where curiosity and proactivity is highly appreciated,
Opportunity to know other countries and cultures
Fast growing company
Meal totally paid by the company
Personal Computer and Smartphone
A permanent contract

What You Will Do In This Role


Repair and maintenance of Material Handling Equipment (MHE) including belt tracking, component adjustment/replacement, component lubrication, etc.

Use electrical test equipment to troubleshoot electrical circuitry.

Develop and maintain positive working relationships across all levels of the organizations. 


What We Are Looking For


High School diploma or equivalent required. Typically, an associate degree or vocational technical training is preferred. Specialized skill training/certification preferred. 
2-3 years of troubleshooting electro-mechanical equipment preferred. 
Proven experience in area of responsibility and successful demonstration of position and key responsibilities as presented above. 
Able to lift and move material up to 50 pounds each. 
Regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head. 
Occasionally push and pull wheeled dollies loaded with products up to 100 pounds. 
Able to climb ladders and gangways safely and without limitation. 
Working conditions may include small spaces, dust, fumes/odors, hot/cold temperatures, inside/outside noise, vibration, standing on concrete for long hours and wet or uneven surfaces.

Flexibility in covering multiple shifts and holiday hours as required.

Tasks and Qualifications:


We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Director of Cloud Governance to join Dematic. As the Director of Cloud Governance, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing strategies to ensure effective and secure management of our cloud infrastructure and services. Your primary responsibility will be to establish and maintain governance frameworks, policies, and procedures to optimize the utilization, security, and compliance of our cloud resources.


This is What You Will do in This Role: 


Develop and implement cloud governance strategies and frameworks to guide the efficient and secure utilization of cloud resources across the Dematic Global Products & Solutions organization. 
Establish policies, procedures, and standards for cloud services, ensuring alignment with industry best practices, compliance requirements, and internal objectives. 
Collaborate closely with Dematic IT to ensure the integration of cloud governance practices with overall IT governance processes, promoting consistency and alignment. 
Work in tandem with the Chief Product Security Officer to ensure that cloud governance aligns with and supports product security strategies, including data protection and privacy measures. 
Design and implement processes for cloud resource provisioning, monitoring, and optimization to ensure optimal performance, scalability, and cost efficiency. 
Identify and mitigate cloud security risks, working closely with the information security team to establish and enforce security controls, incident response procedures, and disaster recovery plans. 
Develop and maintain relationships with cloud service providers, staying updated on their offerings, pricing models, and security features to inform decision-making and ensure adherence to service-level agreements (SLAs). 
Lead cloud governance audits and assessments, identify areas for improvement, and drive the implementation of corrective actions. 
Provide guidance and training to employees on cloud governance policies, best practices, and procedures. 
Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes related to cloud governance, and recommend adjustments to governance strategies as needed. 
Collaborate with executive leadership, Dematic IT, and the Chief Product Security Officer to articulate the business value of effective cloud governance, drive organizational alignment and support, and ensure that cloud governance practices are well-integrated across relevant departments. 


What We are Looking For:


Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or a related field. A master's degree is preferred. 
Proven experience in cloud governance, cloud infrastructure management, or a related role, preferably within a SaaS environment. 
Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts, technologies, and service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS), with expertise in at least one major cloud platform (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). 
Solid knowledge of cloud security principles, best practices, and compliance frameworks (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001). 
Demonstrated ability to develop and implement cloud governance frameworks, policies, and procedures. 
Experience in conducting cloud audits, risk assessments, and compliance reviews. 
Strong project management and organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously. 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
Relevant certifications such as Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP) or Certified Cloud Governance Specialist (CCGS) are a plus. 
Strong leadership skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire teams to achieve goals.

Dematic is searching for an Mechanical Engineering Manager for our new start-up location in Pune, Maharashtra, India. Come be a part of a team that leads with innovation and passion. You will need to be a self-starter with a "can-do" attitude to be successful as the Mechanical Engineering Manager, as you will be one of the first leaders hired onsite, responsible for building a team of Mechanical and Design Engineers, among other leadership activities onsite. Some of your key responsibilities will be as follows:

Project Execution

Ensure all team members have the tools and training to perform required tasks in all work locations safely and efficiently.
Promote safety culture across organization with a focus on zero incidents and 100% compliance.
Ensure accuracy and achievement of performance KPIs for quality, on-time delivery, and cost.
Proactively clear roadblocks to KPI target attainment for project teams.
Foster a culture of compliance through open communication and by empowering all team members to raise potential compliance concerns through the available channels.
Manage project execution risk through validation of project inputs (as-sold project documentation and the project schedule), effective project staffing strategies and comprehensive adherence to standard work and quality processes. Ensure seamless incorporation of India Global Hub support.
As needed, participate in pre-sale technical reviews with Sales & SD as well as regional/local engineering teams. Review for technical and costing accuracy.


Financial

Own short-term monthly forecast across assigned projects independent of resource reporting.
Manage costs throughout the month at the project level and take action as necessary.
Communicate unplanned events to the Project Manager and engineering leadership as appropriate.
Take necessary actions to ensure staffing levels and talent support current and forecasted workload.


People Leadership

Lead team members by example and by living KION's shared Group Values and Leadership Principles.
Engage with peers and people to pulse on sentiment and perceptions. Provide input and recommendations to senior leaders to address opportunities for improvement.
Recognize and promote people and team successes.
Assess and assign appropriate disciplines and skillsets of resources to successfully deliver engineering content utilizing all available talent pools both internal and external.
Identify and implement necessary training to address gaps in resource skills or expertise.
Identify high-potential people for technical SME and leadership roles. Identify stretch assignment opportunities with Sr. Manager.
Support talent development through active and consistent engagement including 1-1 meetings, real-time learning/coaching opportunities, and training programs.
Engage in regular communications with team members via mechanisms such as: 1-1 meetings; project team discussions; peer group meetings; and people feedback, resulting in documentation and tangible examples to support career development, promotion, any necessary Performance Improvement Plans (PIP) and the annual OCTR process.


Initiatives

Identify opportunities and ideas to improve team KPIs and efficiency. Utilize LEAN tools to improve processes and implement change within the team. Support and participate in business initiatives.
Effectively communicate, own the message and implement changes within the team ensuring clear objectives and adherence.

Tasks and Qualifications:


This is What You Will do in This Role: 


Formulate and execute vision AI strategy.
Obtain alignment from key stakeholders to define product roadmap for machine vision uses cases.
Engage with vendors to identify key edge hardware technology.
Frame and solve variety of intralogistics and planning problems with advanced analytics and AI techniques.
See solution through full development cycle from inception to proof of concept, to MVP, to final product deployment.
Ensure what is delivered meets business requirements.
Work directly with real and synthetic data to train models and build data-driven solutions.
Support the matter experts in commercial AI and autonomy solutions delivery.
Identify and develop model-centric solutions architecture.
Apply AI principles and technologies to solve and/or improve planning, automation, search, classification, recommendation, prediction, and optimization problems arising from the need to streamline supply chain operations, sometimes involving the synthesis of components in production.
Keep abreast of state-of-the-art techniques and educate junior scientists.
Write a white paper for each completed solution and disseminate it to executives.
Identify novel applications of vision AI to Dematic problems and pursue the filing of the patent.
Design and build simulation tools of intralogistics processes to train and test models.
Design and build statistical forecasting and machine learning models. Lead and mentor a team of junior scientists.


What We Are Looking For:


Requires a Master’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Electrical Engineering, or a closely related field and 4 years experience as a Software Engineer, AI Scientist, AI Architect, Machine Learning Engineer, or closely related occupation.
Also requires 2 years experience with Python or Java; Statistical or database languages such as R, MATLAB, and SQL; Machine Learning models and techniques: Linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees, SVM, kNN, ensemble learning, XGBoost; Deep Learning architectures and use cases: ANN, CNN, RNN, VAE; Perception, Machine Vision, and Robotics; C++ and widely used AI/ML SDKs on edge devices; Pandas, PyTorch, Tensorflow/Keras, MXNET, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Numpy, fast.ai, Tensorboard, Ignite, Weights and Biases; and identifying and working with applicable key open-source SDKs, frameworks, and tools.
Approximately 20% of travel is required to various unanticipated locations.
Pre-employment processing for this position requires drug testing and passing background checks.
Located at Dematic Corp. in Atlanta, GA

Dematic is a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 6,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.


Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, Dematic is a member of KION Group, a global leader in industrial trucks, related services and supply chain solutions. Across more than 100 countries worldwide, the KION Group designs, builds and supports logistics solutions that optimize material and information flow within factories, warehouses and distribution centers. The company is the largest manufacturer of industrial trucks in Europe, the second-largest producer of forklifts globally and a leading provider of warehouse automation.

Also requires 3 years’ experience with WMS software, package conveyance, sort subsystem, shuttle systems, automated storage and retrieval systems for mini loads, cartons, pallet handling systems, automated guided vehicles, JAVA, SQL, XML, and Soap UI. And one year of experience with high speed carton, mini/unit load cranes, PL/SQL, Unix, and integration of the AutoStore solution. Up to 30% travel required to various unanticipated locations. Pre-employment processing for this position requires drug testing and passing background checks. Telecommuting permitted from anywhere in the U.S. Dematic Corp. headquarters in Grand Rapids, MI. Job Title: Chef de projet logistique/Cheffe de projet logistique
Description:
À la recherche d'une entreprise innovante, mondiale et en constante évolution ? Ne cherchez pas plus loin - Dematic recrute ! Chez Dematic, nous sommes à l'avant-garde de la transformation des chaînes d'approvisionnement mondiales pour intégrer les tendances de la numérisation et du commerce électronique. Nous concevons, construisons et soutenons des solutions intelligentes et automatisées pour une grande variété d'industries. Avec des centres d'ingénierie, des installations de fabrication et des centres de service dans plus de 35 pays, le réseau mondial de Dematic, composé de plus de 11 000 employés, a contribué à la réalisation de près de 8 000 installations pour de nombreuses marques leaders dans le monde.


Où intervenez-vous dans tout cela ? Nous sommes ravis de chercher à recruter un(e) consultant(e) expérimenté(e) en développement de solutions pour rejoindre notre équipe. Dans ce rôle, vous collaborerez étroitement avec les clients et le personnel interne des ventes de Dematic pour élaborer des concepts d'entrepôt de pointe, garantissant que nos solutions non seulement répondent mais dépassent les attentes des clients. Votre rôle consistera à analyser les données commerciales des clients, à élaborer des solutions conceptuelles et à traduire ces idées en mises en page pratiques. Si vous êtes prêt(e) à relever des défis passionnants, à contribuer à des solutions innovantes et à faire partie d'une équipe collaborative et tournée vers l'avenir, nous vous invitons à postuler pour cette opportunité exceptionnelle chez Dematic. Contribuons ensemble à façonner l'avenir de la logistique !


Ce que nous offrons :

Développement de carrière
Rémunération et avantages compétitifs
Transparence salariale
Opportunités mondiales

En savoir plus ici : https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/


Responsabilités principales :

Travailler en partenariat avec le client et le personnel interne des ventes de Dematic pour développer les concepts d'entrepôt appropriés et soutenir les ventes pour atteindre les objectifs en termes de nouvelles commandes.
Analyser les données commerciales du client et examiner et comparer les solutions intralogistiques possibles.
Élaborer une solution conceptuelle basée sur l'analyse des données.
Traduire la solution conceptuelle en mise en page.
Livrer l'offre budgétaire basée sur la mise en page.
Livrer des coûts détaillés basés sur les offres collectées à la fois auprès des fournisseurs internes et externes.
Livraison de la planification d'exécution - selon l'accord avec la gestion de projet.
Veiller à ce que la procédure d'acceptation fasse partie de la proposition commerciale - en accord avec le responsable de l'intégration système.
Travailler avec l'équipe de simulation pour fournir une simulation précise.
Livrer la partie technique de la proposition commerciale basée sur les exigences du client.
Participer aux réunions techniques avec le client.
Collaborer avec l'équipe de développement de solutions EMEA, partager des expériences et des meilleures pratiques.


À propos de vous :

7+ ans d'expérience avérée dans des rôles similaires en logistique.
Compétence démontrée dans l'analyse de données.
Compétence en communication avec les clients.
Bonne connaissance d'AutoCAD et des outils MS Office (PowerPoint, Access, Excel).
Solide expérience technique dans les systèmes logistiques.
Connaissance de base des systèmes WMS/WCS.
Maîtrise complète de l'anglais et du français dans le cadre professionnel.

[ENG]

Servicing heavy equipment, Fixing defective or broken products or ordering the necessary parts to replace faulty or worn-out parts.
Communicate with Engineering department, Development department and product center in overseas
Installing and testing products, equipment, and machinery and providing instructions to customers on the proper usage of their product.
Using diagnostic tools to identify issues and evaluating the available information.
Promoting the company's services.
Answering telephone inquiries and assisting clients.
Maintaining your technical and mechanical skills.

An associate's degree or technical certification in the related field. (Mechanics, electricity, control engineering, automobile or aircraft maintenance)
The ability to work independently.
Managing overtime on service calls with patience and not rushing the job.
Excellent customer service and communication skills.
The ability to diagnose and solve problems based on customers' non-technical descriptions.
Strong working knowledge of equipment and tools used in the industry.
Physical fitness to lift heavy equipment, work in confined spaces, and bend frequently.

Mechanical Engineering internship position will work on projects and initiatives under the supervision of the Sustaining Engineering staff. As part of the team, the intern will develop an understanding for the Sustaining Processes and will use methods, tools, and documentation to support the overall product flow.

We are seeking a highly organized project scheduler to implement and oversee project schedules. In this role, you will be collaborating with project managers, setting tasks, and monitoring the execution of project timelines. You may also prepare project progress and performance evaluation reports.

To ensure success, project schedulers should possess solid industry knowledge and demonstrable experience in project scheduling. A top-notch project scheduler will be someone whose expertise leads to the successful realization of envisaged project goals.

What we offer:

Consulting with project managers and technical experts to set up assignments, tasks, and subtasks.
Developing, implementing, and maintaining an effective scheduling management system.
Coordinating project timelines with internal departments and external stakeholders.
Monitoring project timelines and deadlines.
Identifying potential project schedule delays and facilitating intervention in a timeous manner.
Evaluating performance and preparing project progress reports.
Accommodating updates and changes to project schedules.
Recommending actions to keep projects within budget, and completed on time.
Keeping stakeholders informed of project timelines and deadlines.
Documenting project scheduling processes and maintaining records.

Knowledge & Experience
Bachelor's degree in project management, or in a related field.
Certification as a PMI scheduling professional (PMI-SP) will be advantageous.
A minimum of two years' experience as a project scheduler in a related industry.
Advanced proficiency in project scheduling software, such as monday.com and MS Projects.
Extensive experience in schedule planning and management.
In-depth knowledge of the scope of projects within the industry.
Advanced ability to evaluate project progress and facilitate interventions.
Ability to keep stakeholders informed of project timelines and changes.
Excellent organizational, time-management, and communication skills.
English Language

Job Title: Technical Product Manager - Robotic Systems Development
Description:
Automation is your passion, you see yourself as a central figure in bringing next generation thinking the supply chain industry. Software is your strength. You are capable in defining features and associated business value with respect to Cloud, Enterprises, and Mechatronic based systems. You enjoy the journey as much as the destination. You enjoy managing a broad portfolio of products at different stages of their product lifecycle from sunrise to sunset.

Product Classifications include:

 Warehouse Analytics and AI

 Logistics & Order Routing

 Security and Ad

 Robotic System Control (Autonomous and Automatic) – AMR & AGV

You manage the existing and future software products at the feature level, interfacing with Product Managers of STILL, Linde, and Dematic to create a scaled approach to product launch and product retirement.

You are data driven, balancing the technology and capabilities against business value both by business unit and global region.

You report to the Director of Solution Management as a part of the Robotic Systems Development (RSD) group within KION’s Central Technology Organization (CTO).

20% (Including international)

For over 200 years, Dematic has been a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software, and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 10,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centres and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium, and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.

#In-post

Dematic Pty Ltd is a world leading supplier in the integrated logistics and material handling industry. We provide intelligent logistics solutions for manufacturing and distribution, as well as comprehensive automation and advanced warehouse software solutions, tailored to our clients’ needs.

Our innovative portfolio meets the demands of an ever changing supply chain landscape and is designed to deliver a clear competitive edge. As a company we take pride in offering our employees a safe and rewarding work environment in which to develop their careers.

What we offer:

We currently have an opportunity for a motivated and talented Controls Systems Support Engineer to join our Customer Service team based in Sydney. This position plays a leading role in the deployment and support of electrical control systems.

This includes design, documentation, testing and commissioning of materials handling automation hardware and PLC software. The position also provides opportunities to travel across a number of our customer locations within ANZ.

The successful candidate must have a professional self-driven manner and display a dedication to providing a high quality output as well as the ability to work effectively under pressure in business-critical environments.

Tasks and Qualifications:

Key responsibilities of the position include:

Providing second level technical support to maintenance team as required 
Conformance to OHS&E standards in the design and execution of all work
Prepare/assist with budget costing and quoting
Development of functional specifications
Complete regular system diagnostics and analysis procedures and provide customer reports
Preparation of schematic drawings, PLC programs and configuration of SCADA and PLC-related equipment e.g. HMI’s, Scanners, Roller drive-cards and VSD’s.
Preparation of manufacturing and installation specifications
Planning and supervision of controls installations
Oversee the Controls project cost/budget and schedule control
Report on designed/installed equipment which is not performing to the design specifications
Testing and commissioning of systems on site, some weekend work is to be expected
Preparation of test plans and operator & technical manuals
Training of client personnel and providing customer support
Assist with interstate or some overseas projects when required


What We Are Looking For
Key skills, qualifications and attributes include;

Degree qualified in an engineering or scientific discipline or electrical trade with tertiary qualifications in the areas of engineering/electronics/mechantronics.
Ideally project design and project commissioning experience in Australia
Knowledge of configuration, programming and commissioning of PLCs (Siemens S7 preferred), variable speed drives, barcode scanners and safety devices
Knowledge of SCADA's like ICONICS, CITEC and WINCC
Knowledge of materials handling system controls is highly desirable such as conveyors and sortation systems
Writing of technical documentation
Ability to work without supervision and guide teams/projects
Flexibility to travel interstate, regional areas and overseas
Excellent verbal and written communication
Electrical trades licence qualification is highly regarded

Company Description


Dematic is a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 6,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.


Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, Dematic is a member of KION Group, a global leader in industrial trucks, related services and supply chain solutions. Across more than 100 countries worldwide, the KION Group designs, builds and supports logistics solutions that optimize material and information flow within factories, warehouses and distribution centers. The company is the largest manufacturer of industrial trucks in Europe, the second-largest producer of forklifts globally and a leading provider of warehouse automation.

Develops forecasts, budgets and operating plans for sales channels.

Tasks and Qualifications:


About The Role:


This role will be responsible for driving the definition and ongoing improvement of the enterprise SAAS pricing strategy while also executing the day-to-day operations in support of that strategy.


In this role you will be asked to serve as a hands-on practitioner to drive improved execution and operational excellence in software pricing across the organization. Required skills are strong experience in value-based pricing of cloud subscription products and/or direct experience working in a commercial focused role within a SaaS company.


A successful candidate will have prior pricing experience with subscription model pricing in an enterprise software or SaaS environment and/or management consulting. This role will collaborate with members of a variety of departments, and external parties.


This critical role is responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining global value pricing strategies and practices that drive profitable growth for Dematic. Initially focused on Dematic’s software portfolio, scope will widen to include XaaS strategies including robot-as-a-service and fulfillment-as-a-service.


In This Role, You Will:


Establish sustainable pricing based on customer perceptions of value and competitive differentiation informed by market analysis and customer testing
Develop value pricing strategies that are aligned to the organization’s go-to-market plans
Build and maintain value pricing capabilities, including pricing lists, reference data, and models for the product portfolio
Adapt pricing models and ranges to account for customer segment, region, and other related factors
Run controlled pricing pilots to test and learn new models to support future monetization models and commercial strategies
Implement processes and tools to develop central value-based pricing while enabling regional execution and value-based selling
Drive value-based pricing analytics and use insights to inform product pricing models
Partner with Product Management, Sales, and Finance to align value-based pricing with profitability objectives, and market competitiveness
Work closely with Commercial Finance and Sales to enable value selling based on modelled value pricing
Providing insights and experience regarding cloud subscription and/or SaaS industry best practices.
Provide value pricing expertise and thought leadership while guiding transformational initiatives throughout the organization in partnership with cross-functional teams
Own the strategic rationale and accuracy of value pricing proposals across the product portfolio
Update and enhance developed models and price lists as needed, applying continuous improvement principles
Document pricing policies and processes, communicating them to cross-functional teams as needed
Engage with flexibility in wider product marketing and commercial activities


Your Professional Profile/Qualifications


Substantial pricing experience, with emphasis on value-based methodologies
Substantial experience in a GTM monetization/pricing strategy role. May consider candidates with monetization/pricing experience and a combination of the following areas: consulting, strategic finance or corporate strategy, deal strategy & value management, ideally within a SaaS, enterprise software, or cloud platforms company to equal 5 years or more
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, or related field
Hands-on experience developing models, proofs of concept and business cases to support decision making
Proven ability to work collaboratively across functional teams to deliver results
Strong analysis, strategy development, problem solving and decision-making abilities
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, prioritizing workloads to meet competing deadlines
A team player with exceptional interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills
You are detail-oriented, organized, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Strong proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook is required
Experience with Salesforce is a plus

Tasks and Qualifications:


What You Will Do In This Role


Repair and maintenance of Material Handling Equipment (MHE) including belt tracking, component adjustment/replacement, component lubrication, etc. 
Complete preventative maintenance routines, documentation, and procedures. 
Use electrical test equipment to troubleshoot electrical circuitry. 
Create and close work orders into asset management system with appropriate data to include labor hours, equipment maintenance, and parts used. 
Troubleshoot semi-complex problems and understand resources needed to resolve them. 
Locate and track spare parts from inventory. 
Performs routine maintenance and equipment testing to ensure they meet specifications. 
Respond to service calls and correct equipment failures and faults. 
Identify problems as they occur and take appropriate steps to solve them. 
Develop and maintain positive working relationships across all levels of the organizations. 


What We Are Looking For


High School diploma or equivalent required. Typically, an associate degree or vocational technical training is preferred. Specialized skill training/certification preferred. 
2-3 years of troubleshooting electro-mechanical equipment preferred. 
Proven experience in area of responsibility and successful demonstration of position and key responsibilities as presented above. 
Able to lift and move material up to 50 pounds each. 
Regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head. 
Occasionally push and pull wheeled dollies loaded with products up to 100 pounds. 
Able to climb ladders and gangways safely and without limitation. 
Working conditions may include small spaces, dust, fumes/odors, hot/cold temperatures, inside/outside noise, vibration, standing on concrete for long hours and wet or uneven surfaces. 
Must be able to stand/walk for up to 10–12 hours. 
Flexibility in covering multiple shifts and holiday hours as required.

Dematic recherche un(e) Responsable de site, à embaucher en contrat à durée indéterminée. Le Site Manager devra


 Gérer la phase de démarrage et assurer le déploiement des services conformément au contrat de service
 Planifier et coordonner/prioriser toutes les activités sur site (maintenance préventive/corrective, gestion des pièces détachées, amélioration continue) en tenant compte de l'activité du client. Si besoin, assurer l’engagement des hotlines pour les problèmes inhabituels ou difficiles.
 Être garant des KPIs du contrat de service et rédiger des rapports d’activité, proposer un plan d’action adapté pour les améliorer
 Assister aux réunions périodiques prévues (quotidiennes, hebdomadaires, mensuelles, annuelles) avec les parties prenantes internes/externes.
 Veillez au respect des règles d’hygiène et de sécurité du site
 Être le premier point de contact avec le client et avec le Responsable Maintenance PO France Dematic.
 Collaborer avec d'autres départements en interagissant continuellement avec son équipe sur site .
 Maintenir les procédures de contrôle de la qualité et de la conformité.
 Coordonner toutes les activités des sous-traitants et servir de point de contact principal entre ces activités et le client
 Effectuer des examens fréquents de toutes les maintenances sur site et signaler immédiatement tous les problèmes et les problèmes potentiels de calendrier au responsable du point de vente.
 Assurer la pleine utilisation des outils GMAO pour tous les types de maintenance et la gestion des pièces détachées.
 Garant du bon respect de la procédure de gestion des pièces de rechange et la bonne tenue des stocks de pièces de rechange
 Assurer le management local du personnel Dematic (12personnes),la gestion des plannings, les évaluations de personnel, assurer la motivation et veiller au bon climat social


Réaliser le suivi financier du contrat (dépenses et revenus)

This is a full time permanent role located on our customer site at Moorebank.

Maintain a safe working environment

Use of ERP software to confirm receipt of orders and storage location within the warehouse

Driver’s Licence

Working safely and ensuring those around them work safely

Tasks and Qualifications:

This is a hands on customer service role that requires a self-motivated and customer focused individual. The role will help to deliver support to our clients– including contract repair, preventative maintenance, installations and emergency breakdown services for Dematic customers. The position will require participation in an on-call roster.

In order to be successful in the role, you must have experience in troubleshooting/problem solving mechanical equipment faults, be customer focused and ensure high quality service and output is delivered.

The chance to work for a big international company where our belgian office and AGV factory are playing a big role
Travel opportunities

Tasks and Qualifications:


In the Team of System Engineers, you and your colleagues are responsible for the preparation and implementation of our automatic guided vehicles within Europe and occasionally further abroad.


The role involves working closely with colleagues in different domains to find the optimal, customer-centric solution. Customer focus and problem solving are to be your strongest areas. System engineers receive direct input from customers and other domains on the project team.


To further strengthen the department, we are looking for you as "AGV System Engineer - Project Execution – Mobile Automation" at location in Zwijndrecht (Antwerp) as soon as possible.


Responsibilities:


You define mid and top level behavior of the AGVs, thereby shaping much of the overall behavior of the system. 
You are responsible as an application engineer for checking and validating the correct operation of the vehicles in the final stage of their production in our AGV factory, in cooperation with the test team.
Your are often the first point of contact for the customers during the implementation phase on site.
When finishing a project a system engineer is in charge of creating a training program which can be used by the end users. 
To fit in with our corporate culture, you are accountable, open and driven. In return you can count on our enthusiasm and passion to grow together so we can become a better engineer then we were yesterday !


What we are looking for:


You are interested in the application of high-tech solutions in industrial environments.
You are precise, flexible and conscientious.
You accept responsibility and you share your passion.
You communicate openly.
You like to travel (+- 45%).
You have an excellent knowledge of English.

This is an exciting time to join Dematic. We are a global leader in the material handling industry with over 11,000 employees worldwide and over 600 employees in Australia and New Zealand. We partner with our customers to design, build, implement, and support automated system solutions for warehouses, distribution centres, and production facilities. Some of our largest customers are household names in grocery, pharmaceutical, and parcel delivery, and in the e-commerce online shopping businesses.


As a company we take pride in offering our employees a safe and rewarding work environment in which to develop their careers.

Job Title: Software Test Engineer- Robotics System Development
Description:
Are you ready for a new challenge in the exciting field of mobile robotics? Our multinational automation company specializes in creating innovative mobile robotics systems, and we are looking for a talented and passionate Software Test Engineer to join our team in Belgium. In this role, you will be responsible for testing software on our autonomous guided vehicles.

An international team from our new offices in Antwerp (Linkeroever) 
Opportunities for growth that match your skills and ambition

The ability to work from home (40%) 
An attractive salary package (car, meal vouchers, insurances,...) 
36 vacation days 
No two projects are ever the same


Tasks and Qualifications:


Responsibilities:


You are part of software development team and responsible for all test (automation) activities on our automated guided vehicles (AGVs), including unit testing, integration testing, end-to-end testing
You review User Stories for testability, create test plans and test cases, execution test plans and providing feedback on the test results to the developers of your team
You contribute to and leverage existing test automation tools as part of the CI/CD pipeline
You adhere to the scaled agile way of working in the product team and participate in (scaled) agile ceremonies
You adhere to the proposed guidelines and tools on Test Automation
You actively participate in Testing Chapter, challenge and contribute to best practices on test automation 
You follow the evolutions in software test automation and apply then in a pragmatic way
You take – together with the other team members - ownership to the team deliverable and pro-actively support other team members in delivering the committed backlog


Competences


You have 5+ years of experience as a Software Test Engineer or a similar role
You have experience with Software Test Automation tools and CI/CD pipelines
You have a strong interest in motion control, automation or robotics.
Your experience with agile software development is a plus
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
You are pro-active, self-motivated and take initiative within the team
You have excellent communication and collaboration skills
Professional proficiency in English 


We're looking for someone who is passionate about what they do and wants to make a real difference in the exciting field of mobile robotics. In fact, we're so confident that you'll love this job that we'll say it's like a fungus that grows on you - but in a good way! You'll be working on cool shit that will challenge and inspire you every day.


So, if you're ready to take your career to the next level and work with a dynamic and fun team that is changing the game in mobile robotics, apply now!

These requirements are related to software (e.g., log-file analysis, remote connectivity), hardware (e.g., component access) or service tools and processes (e.g., guided diagnosis / troubleshooting)

Ensure efficient serviceability of the global mobile automation product portfolio for service technicians on-site (for troubleshooting, repair and maintenance), as well as for 2nd and 3rd level technical support
Ensure harmonized, future-oriented service concepts across the different vehicle types in the global portfolio
Closely collaborate with the neighboring Program Management department to ensure that these requirements get transferred into R&D processes, are being followed up upon and realized as service features
Regularly inform the neighboring Service departments and make sure that changes or new service features are also respected e.g., in Training, Documentation and Technical Support, in line with product roadmaps
Look into service concepts of competitor vehicles and continuously drive serviceability improvements 
You closely collaborate with the Customer Service departments of the KION Operating Units, our program management and R&D departments, as well as the adjacent Service departments for automation (Training, Documentation, Technical Support, Spare Parts)


Qualifications: 


University degree or comparable education with a technical (preferred) or business focus
Min. 3-5 years or more of relevant experience within the Automation Industry, (Automated) Material Handling Solutions, Machinery & Industrial Engineering or related industries
Experience in the field of After Sales service products and processes (e.g., direct customer service support remotely and on-site (service engineer), technical customer service support, service trainer, technical product management, service project manager or similar)
Very good technical understanding, good knowledge of new technologies
Affinity towards technical and software topics
Good knowledge of service-relevant business models
Team player with a high level of communication and negotiating skills
Strategic thinking and ability to manage complexity
Ability to operate in an international team and perform in a global matrix organization
Fluency in English, additional languages are a plus
Flexibility and willingness to international travel (10-20%)

What we offer:

Maintenir les installations Dematic dans leur fonctionnement optimal sur le site client Décathlon à Evin Malmaison.

Vos missions sont les suivantes :

Garantir des interventions curatives et préventives sur une installation logistique en respectant les consignes de sécurité,
Diagnostiquer l’origine d’une panne, grâce à vos connaissances et à l’utilisation de l’ensemble des moyens mis à disposition pour réduire les temps d’arrêts,
Reporter l’analyse de la panne et pouvoir être acteur d’évolution afin de garantir et pérenniser la disponibilité des installations de notre client,
Réaliser les interventions préventives en suivant le plan de maintenance,
Assurer la sortie des pièces détachées nécessaire à la bonne réalisation de l’intervention,
Reporter l’état du stock afin de pouvoir assurer le réapprovisionnement des pièces,
Reporter toutes les interventions sur un outil de Gestion de Maintenance Assisté par Ordinateur (GMAO)


Travail posté, en semaine et/ou mardi au samedi sur une base 35h hebdomadaire.

Bien entendu, cette description n’est pas limitative.

Tasks and Qualifications:

Votre profil :

Idéalement, vous avez une formation technique d’électromécanicien et/ou d'automaticien (ex: BAC + 2 CRSA).

Vous êtes quelqu’un d’autonome et serez force de proposition dans votre équipe.
Vous êtes à l'aise avec l'informatique (WMS, WCS), idéalement.
Des connaissances en automatisme seraient un plus
Vous maîtrisez l’outil informatique MS Office.
La disposition du permis de conduire serait un plus, des déplacements exceptionnels pourront être demandés.


Nous vous offrons :

Un poste en CDI à temps plein
Une participation aux activités culturelles ou sportives, des chèques vacances, des chèques cadeaux

Un parcours d’intégration personnalisé
