What we offer:


We are seeking an experienced developer who is passionate about developing high-quality software solutions using the agile methodology. You will be responsible for developing software that meets the needs of the customer and aligns with the agile principles and practices. You will work closely with the Product Owner, Scrum Master, and other roles in the SAFe agile framework to deliver value to the customer.


International travel will be necessary every few months to facilitate quarterly planning and foster relationships with teams from diverse backgrounds.


Tasks and Qualifications:


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Develop software solutions that meet the needs of the customer and align with the SAFe principles and practices.
Work with the Product Owner to understand the requirements and priorities of the product backlog.
Collaborate with other Developers and team members to design and implement software features.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
Perform unit testing and ensure that the software meets the quality standards.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-up meetings, sprint review, and sprint retrospective.
Work with the Scrum Master to identify and remove impediments that are preventing the team from reaching their goals.
Continuously learn and stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, best practices, and industry trends.


Qualifications:


Required Qualifications:


Minimum of 4 years of experience in software development.
Strong programming skills in at least one programming language, such as Java, C++, or Python.
Experience with web development technologies, such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
Strong communication and collaboration skills. Fluent in English.


Preferred Qualification:


Experience working with REST APIs and NoSQL databases (MongoDB a plus)
Experience with Java microservice frameworks like Spring Boot, Quarkus, etc.
Experience with version control tools, such as Git.
Experience with Agile methodologies


Education:


Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field; MSc/MA is a plus


Supervisor Responsibilities:


None

What we offer:


An international environment
Enthusiastic team of co-workers
High-tech working environment and business that's always evolving
A comprehensive package of extralegal benefits (meal vouchers, insurances,...) 
Competitive salary (Company car, insurances, meal vouchers,...)

As an Electrical Engineer for our mobile automation department, you take full responsibility for electronical controls engineering of medium complexity project vehicles according to defined concepts.


Responsibilities:


You assist in defining project concepting with a focus on standardisation and cross project conformity
In collaboration with lead engineers you are responsible for electrical engineering of complex project vehicles
You actively implement and help to refine process and procedure in collaboration with team manager and lead engineers
You work efficiently according to agreed project planning and align with team manager, mechanical and software engineering to drive the project forward
You cultivate and promote our corporate values: integrity, collaboration, courage, excellence

An electrical engineering Bachelor’s degree or comparable training
Preferably 2-5 years of relevant experience within Automation Industry, (Automated) Material Handling Solutions, Machinery & Industrial Engineering or related electrical controls industries

Dematic Pty Ltd, a world leading supplier of integrated logistics and material handling solutions currently has an opportunity for a motivated and talented Maintenance Supervisor. The position will be located at one of our major client sites in Moorebank, NSW.

This challenging position requires a self-driven and experienced supervisor who can coordinate and lead the residential service team, grow the relationship with the customer and maintain a safe work environment. The team are skilled tradesman.

What we offer:

Manage and develop a multi skilled residential service team by setting clear goals and responsibilities in order to meet or exceed customer expectations.
Maintain and enhance an effective ongoing relationship with the customer.
Assign work schedules and develop the roster for the residential service team.
Developing a positive team culture and environment that generates a high level of personal accountability and high performance standards.
Deliver a plant reliability and maintenance schedule program to ensure continuous improvement and minimise downtime.
Ensure all staff comply with administrative requirements including reporting and timesheets.
Provide regular staff usage reports and forecast work loading to enable forward planning of resources.
Overview the spare parts inventory management and orders.
Identify and implement efficiency programs.
Operate within maintenance expenditure budget and control costs.
Ensure compliance with relevant ISO procedures.
Ensure compliance with all Dematic safety regulations and legislation.
Inspire a safety conscious culture and conduct regular toolbox meetings.


Tasks and Qualifications:

Must have completed either an Electrical or Mechanical trade qualification. Applicants with Engineering Degree are also desirable.
Experienced in managing technical and trade qualified teams delivering maintenance services, including sound people management and HR experience is ideal.
Ideally 5 years’ experience working in a customer service environment in a similar supervisory role.
Excellent communication and leadership skills, including ability to liaise with all levels of staff and customer.
Robust experience working with CMMS (MEX) and exposure to Siemens S7
Able to work a flexible roster on short notice to meet the requirements of the role.
Strong problem solving skills and the ability to see a task through to completion.
Integrated systems experience within a material handling environment an advantage.


To meet the requirements and challenges of the position, you will enjoy a hands on approach and be involved in the day to day operations.

An attractive salary package is on offer based upon experience plus tool of trade vehicle is provided.

System Integration Managers play a vital role in the success of our projects and are the all-important “Voice of Engineering” that ensures the solutions we deliver are delivered to specification with the customer’s requirements at the forefront of everyone’s mind.


The SIM’s role is to ensure design integrity across the project and provide proactive technical risk management ensuring that the integrated solution meets requirements for functionality and throughput as defined in the contract and measured by acceptance testing, starting in the Sales phase, and concluding at hand-over to Customer Service.


We are excited to announce that we are looking to strengthen our EMEA Systems Integration function. This remotely based position will spend the majority of the time on various customer sites around the country and drive both user and solutions acceptance testing to increase the right-first-time acceptance of our technology in the wider automated materials handling solution.


Life At Dematic:



For over 200 years, Dematic has been a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software, and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 10,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium, and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.


Key Responsibilities: 



The SIM provides the "voice of Engineering" to the Solutions Development team to optimize automation solutions pre-sale, reviewing and providing input on the solution and acceptance testing language
Supporting the Simulation team by providing technical advice, reviewing, and approving simulation output and report in alignment with SD and Sales; anticipating the impact of any deviations from established parameters; providing early awareness to the customer of their responsibilities that influence system performance
Generate System Specifications for customer approval and understanding of the system
Defining and leading integration strategy during all phases of the project, from Solutions through Execution
Ensuring that the System Specification, Software Functional Specification, acceptance test plan, and mechanical and controls deliverables are aligned to contractual requirements, interfaces and nomenclature is consistent, and that the system will meet expected throughput
In collaboration with Test Manager, leading completion of site-wide system testing, including comprehensive documentation of test strategy, test plan (for internal and customer-witnessed tests), simulation and emulation tests, detailed testing specifications, and results
Producing system availability weightings; overseeing calculation of the appropriate FEM availability method


Qualifications & Experience:



Master’s degree in Industrial plant or Mechatronic or Mathematics.
At least 4 years of experience in development or technical management field (possibly in high–level automated logistic business).
It would be beneficial to have previous experience as a Software engineer in warehouse management systems, but this is not an essential requirement.
4+ years’ experience in engineering with demonstrated experience in the material handling industry preferred.
Functional leadership and communications oriented.
Demonstrated ability to create technical documentation.
Ability to be customer-facing, good with customer interaction.
Collaborative and effective team player and able to work with teams who are regionally located.
Availability to travel especially on domestic destinations for 50%/60% of the time.
Written and verbal fluency in both French and English are essential.
Full driver’s license to support the travel requirements of the role.

Dematic has an excellent opportunity for a Mobile Multi-Skilled Engineer to join our engineering team on a permanent basis. The role forms part of a wider mobile engineering team who are collectively responsible for undertaking and providing breakdown cover for Dematic installed equipment across various customer sites in the UK.


The position will also support the occasional scheduled service work with a distinct focus on mechanical and electrical equipment within automated systems. We are seeking those with a bias in mechanical systems with the addition of electrical knowledge to help support the requirements of our customers.


Due to the mobile nature of the position, you will be travelling out to various customer sites across the UK on a regular basis and providing call-out support for emergency breakdowns. Tasks and Qualifications:


What You Will Do In This Role


Repair and maintenance of Material Handling Equipment (MHE) including belt tracking, component adjustment/replacement, component lubrication, etc. 
Complete preventative maintenance routines, documentation, and procedures. 
Create and close work orders into asset management system with appropriate data, to include labor hours, equipment maintenance, and parts used. 
Troubleshoot basic conveyance problems and understand the resources to resolve them. 
Locate and track spare parts from inventory. 
Respond to semi-complex service calls and correct equipment failures and faults. 
Identify problems as they occur and take appropriate steps to solve them. 
Develop and maintain positive working relationships across all levels of the organization. 


What We Are Looking For


High School diploma or equivalent required. Typically, vocational technical training preferred. 
Able to lift and move material up to 50 pounds each. 
Regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head. 
Occasionally push and pull wheeled dollies loaded with products up to 100 pounds. 
Have functional dexterity in both hands and wrists. 
Able to climb ladders and gangways safely and without limitation. 
Working conditions may include small spaces, dust, fumes/odors, hot/cold temperatures, inside/outside noise, vibration, standing on concrete for long hours and wet or uneven surfaces. 
Must be able to stand/walk for up to 10–12 hours. 
Flexibility in covering multiple shifts and holiday hours as required.

Dematic is a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 6,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.


Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, Dematic is a member of KION Group, a global leader in industrial trucks, related services and supply chain solutions. Across more than 100 countries worldwide, the KION Group designs, builds and supports logistics solutions that optimize material and information flow within factories, warehouses and distribution centers. The company is the largest manufacturer of industrial trucks in Europe, the second-largest producer of forklifts globally and a leading provider of warehouse automation.

What You Will Do In This Role

Able to lift and move material up to 50 pounds each. 
Regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head.

Description:
To further strengthen the automated guided vehicle R&D department, we are looking for you as "Automation Test Specialist AGV (m/f/x)" at location in Antwerp.


The role involves testing standard controls software for Autonomous Guided Vehicles and mobile robotics applications.


As part of an international and multicultural team within the software development organization, you will be responsible for testing software on our autonomous guided vehicles.


What we offer:


The opportunity to work with a world leading supplier of Mobile Automation solutions 
An international team from our new offices in Antwerp (Linkeroever)

36 vacation days 
No two projects are ever the same!

Ok with traveling abroad occasionally for work.

What You Will Do In This Role


Repair and maintenance of Material Handling Equipment (MHE) including belt tracking, component adjustment/replacement, component lubrication, etc. 
Complete preventative maintenance routines, documentation, and procedures. 
Use electrical test equipment to troubleshoot electrical circuitry. 
Create and close work orders into asset management system with appropriate data to include labor hours, equipment maintenance, and parts used. 
Troubleshoot semi-complex problems and understand resources needed to resolve them. 
Locate and track spare parts from inventory. 
Performs routine maintenance and equipment testing to ensure they meet specifications. 
Respond to service calls and correct equipment failures and faults. 
Identify problems as they occur and take appropriate steps to solve them. 
Develop and maintain positive working relationships across all levels of the organizations. 


What We Are Looking For


High School diploma or equivalent required. Typically, an associate degree or vocational technical training is preferred. Specialized skill training/certification preferred. 
2-3 years of troubleshooting electro-mechanical equipment preferred. 
Proven experience in area of responsibility and successful demonstration of position and key responsibilities as presented above. 
Able to lift and move material up to 50 pounds each. 
Regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head. 
Occasionally push and pull wheeled dollies loaded with products up to 100 pounds. 
Able to climb ladders and gangways safely and without limitation. 
Working conditions may include small spaces, dust, fumes/odors, hot/cold temperatures, inside/outside noise, vibration, standing on concrete for long hours and wet or uneven surfaces.

Flexibility in covering multiple shifts and holiday hours as required.

Are you interested in becoming an Apprentice Mechanical Fitter, located at one of our major customer sites working with cutting edge technology in automation and robotics?


Power your future. Start your dream career with the Dematic Apprenticeship Program in January 2024!


Who are Dematic?


We are a global leader in the material handling industry with over 11,000 employees worldwide and over 700 employees in Australia and New Zealand. We partner with our customers to design, build, implement, and support automated system solutions for warehouses and distribution centres. Some of our largest customers are household names in grocery, pharmaceutical, and parcel delivery, and in the e-commerce online shopping businesses.


What we offer:

Turbo charged learning with dedicated support from a Technical Training Manager and mentors
Full tool kit, uniform and personal protective gear supplied
Rotate between multiple large-scale sites and projects
Secure, supportive and safe work environment


Tasks and Qualifications:


The Opportunity


We are currently offering an apprenticeship in:


Mechanical - (Cert III in Engineering – Mechanical Trade)


Upon completion, you will be fully certified, with experience in complex industrial environments and have access to a variety of career options across the national Dematic business including: Field Service or On-site Maintenance Technician, Controls Engineer, Electrical Engineer or Project Site Supervisor positions.


About You


We are keen to hear from you if you are:


A current apprentice who is part way through an apprenticeship (you might be 1st year, mid-term or mature age)
Motivated and willing to learn, with a genuine interest for all things Mechanical
Passionate about robotics, gadgets, gidgets, gaming, automation, electronics, mechanical systems or cars
A good communicator with strengths in mathematics or science
A positive attitude, and willingness to tackle anything that comes your way
Must have full Australian working rights


Our Application Process


Step One – Apply! Easy peasy! Please submit your current resume and a brief cover letter explaining why you would like to be an apprentice with us. Please also include either your most recent school report or TAFE transcripts. 
Step Two – An informal initial phone chat to get to know you a little better
Step Three – Interview and pre-employment checks. This includes medical with drug and alcohol testing, background checks and references. 
The Grand Finale – the formal offer, with a start date late January 2024

For over 200 years, Dematic has been a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software, and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 10,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium, and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.

As a Costing Manager at Dematic, your primary responsibility will be to support the successful implementation of the Quotation Management Application (QMA) costing tool. You will collaborate with various stakeholders to drive efficiency, reduce overspends or underspends, and support project estimations within the EMEA regions.


Your role will also involve interfacing with global Solution Development (SD) disciplines driving improvements to the QMA tool, and providing vital costing to the new solutions and projects ensuring customer satisfaction and the achievement of order intake targets. This opportunity is available on a twelve-month fixed-term basis with hybrid working flexibility from our UK head office in Adderbury, Oxfordshire.


Life At Dematic:



For over 200 years, Dematic has been a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software, and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 10,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium, and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.


Key Responsibilities: 



Analyse costing data and collaborate with relevant disciplines to continuously improve the EMEA QMA costing model.
Update the EMEA maestro services catalogue and EMEA QMA calculations.
Communicate EMEA needs, prioritize bugs and enhancements, and advocate for improvements to the group's tools.
Focus on streamlining the costing process and aid in the development of harmonized standard costing using highly automated tools.
Provide training and assistance to users, diagnosing QMA issues as needed.
Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) of maestro/QMA in the Quality Assurance (QA) environment.
Collaborate with software developers to define, schedule, and release enhancements to the QMA tool.
Facilitate the exchange of ideas, developments, and feedback within the Costing Community.
Offer project estimation support to the EMEA regions.
Interface with global roles, such as Global Solution Owner (GSO) and Global Product Specialist (GPS), to advocate for EMEA requirements.
Interact with other EMEA communities to drive harmonization across SD EMEA.
Update costing models by identifying trends, considering stakeholders' views, and recommending solutions to improve performance, order intake, and execution.
Collaborate with functional and global teams to support the delivery of global and regional costing-related priorities, fostering competitiveness and innovation.
Resolve complex operational matters, foster relationships, and always act with integrity.
Recommend solutions to improve performance and execution of the costing process within Solution Development (SD).


Qualifications & Experience: 



Experience in a global, fast-paced, innovative engineering/technology company.
Proven track record of utilizing data and metrics to evaluate needs, drive change, and measure impact.
Strong analytical skills using tools such as Excel, SQL databases, and Power BI.
Demonstrated ability to build credibility and confidence with a diverse range of stakeholders.
Ability to navigate competing priorities, flexibility, and adaptability in a constantly changing business environment.
Strong Agile/Scrum experience is beneficial.
Customer-focused mindset with a track record of delivering results.
Unquestioned integrity, assertiveness, presence, and confidence in carrying out responsibilities.

Wir, die Dematic, sind ein weltweit führender Anbieter für Logistikautomatisierung und liefern als System-Integrator die gesamte Leistungspalette. Dazu gehören die Planung, Realisierung, Implementierung und Unterstützung automatisierter Systemlösungen für Lager, Verteilerzentren und Produktionsstätten. Prozessverbesserungen, Materialflussautomatisierung und Software zur Leistungsoptimierung bilden die Komponenten jeder Lösung.


Mit über 10.000 Mitarbeitern weltweit erwirtschaften wir einen Umsatz von ca. 1,6 Mrd. Euro. Unser Hauptsitz ist in den USA in Atlanta, Georgia. Mit weltweit 60 Engineering Center in 25 Ländern implementiert sowie Produktionsstätten in Nordamerika, Europa, China und Australien sind wir Partner für namhaften Kunden rund um automatisierte Lager Logistik.

Au sein d'une équipe de 15 personnes opérationnelles le rôle du Technicien de maintenance est d'assurer la maintenance préventive et corrective des process de notre client à Wattrelos (59).

Reporter toutes les interventions sur un outil de Gestion de Maintenance Assisté par Ordinateur (GMAO)

Job Title: Mobile Robot Software Portfolio Manager – Robotic Systems Development
Description:
Automation is your passion, you see yourself as a central figure in bringing next generation thinking the supply chain industry. Software is your strength. You are capable in defining features and associated business value with respect to Cloud, Enterprises, and Mechatronic based systems. You enjoy the journey as much as the destination. You enjoy managing a broad portfolio of products at different stages of their product lifecycle from sunrise to sunset.


Product Classifications include:


 Warehouse Analytics and AI


 Logistics & Order Routing


 Security and Ad


 Robotic System Control (Autonomous and Automatic) – AMR & AGV


You manage the existing and future software products at the feature level, interfacing with Product Managers of STILL, Linde, and Dematic to create a scaled approach to product launch and product retirement.


You are data driven, balancing the technology and capabilities against business value both by business unit and global region.


You report to the Director of Solution Management as a part of the Robotic Systems Development (RSD) group within KION’s Central Technology Organization (CTO).


What we offer:


The opportunity to work in a fast growing technological company
An international environment
Flexible working hours
The ability to work from home (40%)
An attractive salary package (car, meal vouchers, insurances,...)
36 vacation days


Tasks and Qualifications:


Key Responsibilities:


Strong interaction with KION’s Operating Units sales and product management representing the voice of the OUs for the agile release train (ART). Be the link between RSD Automated Systems (Product Owners / Validation) and our internal customers (“the Operating Units”)..
Understanding market needs and translating them into strategic roadmap is key. Aligning this roadmap to internal / external stakeholders.
Organizing and ensuring the transfer of innovation into the product/project groups according to KIONs core strategy and requirements of individual OUs underpinning advanced intercultural leadership and willingness to do international travel (20%).
Ensuring timely and accurate reporting of department performance and project performance. Creating and maintaining the RSD software roadmap for Sofware & Data, Connectivity, and Machine / Device level products.
In collaboration with the architects they also defines and maintains the Nonfunctional Requirements (NFRs) to help ensure that the solution meets relevant standards and other system quality requirements.
Manage and prioritize the flow of work through the program Kanban and into the program backlog ensuring the availability of sufficient features ready to deploy in the backlog at all times.
Build up an effective requirement management/product owner team is the key to efficient and effective development.


Education


Master degree with a technical focus preferred. Additional economic degree desirable (MBA).


Experience & Skills


Strong team and collaboration skills.
Effective communication skills with the ability to properly communicate to a variety of audiences.
Experience executing effort in a Scrum framework.
Ability to understand the customer(s) point of view, and how that guides the project’s requirements.
Eagerness to guide a team to their goals.
Action-oriented with a positive & engaging energy.
Understanding of the fundamentals of iterative development.
Technical ability in mechatronics or software development.
Practical experience in automation and robotics is necessary. Affinity with AGV / AMR is highly required. Mobile automation should make your day!
Valid knowledge of software development is more than a plus.
Fluent in English language (additional languages such as French, German, Dutch or Chinese are a plus)
Leadership responsibility within cross-functional multi-disciplinary teams of a global matrix organization
High ability to think and act entrepreneurially considering risk and opportunity analysis to compile decision proposals
Experienced within global project business and execution
Team player with exceptional interpersonal skills, such as communication and analytical skills and the ability to lead a global high performing team
Willingness to go the extra mile to anticipate, understand and respond to customer’s needs


Direction Of Others


Typically, direction of tasks and coordination of teams along with team leads. No direct reports.


Key Working Relationships


Primarily intra-organizational contacts.


Travel


20% (Including international)

System Integration Managers play a vital role in the success of our projects and are the all-important “Voice of Engineering” that ensures the solutions we deliver are delivered to specification with the customer’s requirements at the forefront of everyone’s mind.


The SIM’s role is to ensure design integrity across the project and provide proactive technical risk management ensuring that the integrated solution meets requirements for functionality and throughput as defined in the contract and measured by acceptance testing, starting in the Sales phase, and concluding at hand-over to Customer Service.


We are excited to announce that we are looking to strengthen our EMEA Systems Integration function. This remotely based position will spend the majority of the time on various customer sites around the country and drive both user and solutions acceptance testing to increase the right-first-time acceptance of our technology in the wider automated materials handling solution.


What we offer:


Career Development
Competitive Compensation and Benefits
Pay Transparency
Global Opportunities


Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/


Life At Dematic:


For over 200 years, Dematic has been a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software, and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 10,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium, and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.


Tasks and Qualifications:


Key Responsibilities: 


The SIM provides the "voice of Engineering" to the Solutions Development team to optimize automation solutions pre-sale, reviewing and providing input on the solution and acceptance testing language
Supporting the Simulation team by providing technical advice, reviewing, and approving simulation output and report in alignment with SD and Sales; anticipating the impact of any deviations from established parameters; providing early awareness to the customer of their responsibilities that influence system performance
Generate System Specifications for customer approval and understanding of the system
Defining and leading integration strategy during all phases of the project, from Solutions through Execution
Ensuring that the System Specification, Software Functional Specification, acceptance test plan, and mechanical and controls deliverables are aligned to contractual requirements, interfaces and nomenclature is consistent, and the system will meet expected throughput
In collaboration with Test Manager, leading completion of site-wide system testing, including comprehensive documentation of test strategy, test plan (for internal and customer-witnessed tests), simulation and emulation tests, detailed testing specifications, and results
Producing system availability weightings; overseeing calculation of the appropriate FEM availability method


Qualifications & Experience:


Master’s degree in Industrial plant or Mechatronic or Mathematics.
At least 4 years of experience in development or technical management field (possibly in high–level automated logistic business).
It would be beneficial to have previous experience as a Software engineer in warehouse management systems, but this is not an essential requirement.
4+ years’ experience in engineering with demonstrated experience in the material handling industry preferred.
Functional leadership and communications oriented.
Demonstrated ability to create technical documentation.
Ability to be customer-facing, good with customer interaction.
Collaborative and effective team player and able to work with teams who are regionally located.
Availability to travel especially on domestic destinations for 50%/60% of the time.
Fluency in both Spanish and English is required for the position.
Full driver’s license to support the travel requirements of the role.


Dematic is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. Dematic prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, religion or belief, age, sex, national or ethnic origin, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

We are actively seeking a Resident Maintenance Technician to join us at a dedicated customer site in Bolton. The position will form part of a two-person team responsible for maintaining and repairing state-of-the-art Dematic installed automation equipment at the customer’s micro fulfillment center.


Reporting to the Regional Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for maintaining, repairing, and supporting the automated materials picking and handling system installed at the site. This is an exciting opportunity to work with the very latest technology in the industry and help us on our journey to provide an exceptional service to an ever-growing customer.


When you join our team, you will be empowered to think big and take charge of your career; allowing you to shape your future as you tackle some of the toughest technical and logistical challenges around. We need your tech-savvy and innovative approach to help us continue to transform the industry with world-class, leading-edge solutions.

Global Opportunities

Carry out automated material handling and equipment servicing in accordance with the quality standards and time schedules as set out in the equipment manuals
To undertake scheduled repairs in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations and industry standard practices
Diagnosis of Mechanical / Electrical / Electronic / PLC / PC faults and subsequent repairs
To comply with Health & Safety legislation at all times
To ensure the quality of output at all times
To accurately record all work undertaken
Involvement in continuous improvement and sales opportunities
To ensure on-site spares are kept to optimum levels
To represent the company in a professional manner at all times and maintain customer relations

ONC or equivalent qualification in Electrical / Mechanical Engineering
Preferably a recognised engineering apprenticeship 
A working understanding of Mechanical, Electrical & Electronic technical manuals & drawings

Basic understanding of PLC equipment
Experience working at height
Previous experience in working with various conveyor systems
IT literacy
Understanding of planned preventive maintenance (PPM) schedules
Working knowledge of FEM and BS standards governing the automated warehouse industry would be desirable but not essential

De job


Ben je een gebeten Field Service Engineer met een passie voor hoogtechnologische ontwikkelingen? Hou je ervan deze om te zetten naar realistische oplossingen op maat? Wil je van het motto, “We Deliver”, ook het jouwe maken? Dan ben jij bij Dematic aan het juiste adres!


Functie: 


Jij bent verantwoordelijk voor het onderhoud van de installaties bij onze klanten. Dit zowel voor correctief, preventief als predictief onderhoud.
Je voert noodreparaties uit en lost storingen op
Het mechanisch en elektrisch onderhoud aan conveyors, transportbanden, kranen, AGV’s, etc. voer je uit rekening houdend met de veiligheidsvoorschriften.
Je bent voor 1 dag of langere tijd aanwezig op de locatie van de klant, zowel binnen België als in het buitenland.
Soms werk je alleen maar meestal maak je deel uit van een team. Binnen onze bedrijfscultuur rekenen wij op jouw verantwoordelijkheidszin, openheid en gedrevenheid en kan jij daarmee rekenen op ons enthousiasme en passie om samen verder te groeien. 


 Profiel 


Je hebt een diploma elektromechanica, mechanica of elektriciteit.
Basiskennis van automatisatie behoort tot je competenties.
Een 3-tal jaar ervaring is een pluspunt.
Zelfstandig werken en individueel storingen oplossen is voor jou geen probleem.
Je hebt interesse in de toepassing van hoogtechnologische oplossingen in industriële omgevingen.
Je werkt correct en houdt ook de nodige documenten correct bij.
Je neemt verantwoordelijkheid op.
Je deelt vlot je passie.
Je communiceert open in het Nederlands, Engels en graag ook Frans.
Shift- en weekendwerk vormen geen probleem voor jou 
Om geplande reparaties uit te voeren in overeenstemming met de aanbevelingen van de fabrikant en de standaardpraktijken van de industrie.

We are looking for a Solution Consultant to strengthen our Solution Development team. In this role you translate the customer data and requirements into a fitting automated intralogistics solution.


What we offer:


An open culture with colleagues fascinated by technology.
An organization in which there is room for initiative and consultation.
Training and courses which will contribute to your personal development.
The opportunity to expand your horizons, both literally and figuratively! 
And, of course, an attractive remuneration package.


Tasks and Qualifications:


Responsibilities and Duties:


Derive multiple conceptual ideas for an intralogistics solution, evaluate and compare these and select the best fitting concept for both the customer and us. 
Identify and apply standard products, modules, subsystems and solutions and align where needed with the global product managers and COE's. 
Develop a 3D-model and make a high level budget (Rough Order of Magnitude) of the proposed solution. 
Provide key information to the simulation team and work closely with them to make sure that the proposed solution reaches the required performance. 
Create presentations including but not limited to visuals, graphs and tables to be used for customer meetings and internal review meetings. 
Together with the sales manager participate in customer meetings to better understand the customer requirements, site conditions and to present the proposed solution.
Continuously improve your knowledge and identify trends and drivers in our customer industries, advise both the customer and internal teams on the best intralogistics practices.
Ensure compliance with the commercial process taking both the customer and internal milestones in mind.
Communicate project progress and updates to stakeholders and team members regularly within the defined channels.
Perform data analysis on the provided customer data, derive a material flow diagram and an overview on materials to be handled. 
Share experiences and best practices with other colleagues in solution development EMEA. 
You work in close relation with the sales, other solution development team members, global product managers and COE's, … . 


Requirements:


You have a degree in engineering or a comparable professional qualification.
You have multiple (5+) years of experience in a similar function within the intralogistics automation industry. 
You have experience with data analysist and are able to derive the needed information to define a fitting solution.
You are up-to-date on the latest trends within the industry and know important drivers within 


Skills:

Warehousing and logistics systems play an increasingly critical role in contributing to the competitiveness of many companies and, at the same time, to the effectiveness of the general world economy. The modern intra-logistics solutions combine state-of-the-art mechatronics, complex software, advanced robotics, modern computational perception, and sophisticated AI and operations research algorithms to provide high throughput and efficient processing for many mission-critical commercial logistics applications.


We are looking for a dynamic, innovation-minded AMR/Robotics leader to lead the development of software for fleets of autonomous robots, with possible swarm robotics behavior, to solve challenging problems in:


Autonomous robotic innovations and research include novel ways of intelligent navigation, path planning while minimizing energy usage, and the ability to operate accurately at high speeds in communication-denied and GPS-denied environments.


Autonomous robots that collaboratively accomplish warehouse automation and material flow tasks, with the goal of quick market introduction, using agile methodologies.


Apply modern AI and machine learning methodologies to solve complex robotics problems involving synthesis of solutions that can measurably streamline operations of fleet and swarms of robots.


Research, define and implement intelligent robot behavior onboard for collision avoidance and energy optimization.


Develop novel perception-based navigation solutions, leveraging advances in sensor technology and sensor fusion algorithms and the power of IoT and AI at the edge and in the cloud, that can demonstrably increase the reliability and adaptive control of highly automated mobile robot systems.


Contribute to application of deep learning in mobile robotic navigation algorithms.


Provide contribution or subject matter expertise in developing various robotic fleet management, AMR energy management, Dynamic path optimization and analytics related products (descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive) with ability to offer these products in a cloud-based As-a-Service delivery model.

What we offer:

Maintenir les installations Dematic dans leur fonctionnement optimal sur le site client Décathlon à Evin Malmaison.

Vos missions sont les suivantes :

Garantir des interventions curatives et préventives sur une installation logistique en respectant les consignes de sécurité,
Diagnostiquer l’origine d’une panne, grâce à vos connaissances et à l’utilisation de l’ensemble des moyens mis à disposition pour réduire les temps d’arrêts,
Reporter l’analyse de la panne et pouvoir être acteur d’évolution afin de garantir et pérenniser la disponibilité des installations de notre client,
Réaliser les interventions préventives en suivant le plan de maintenance,
Assurer la sortie des pièces détachées nécessaire à la bonne réalisation de l’intervention,
Reporter l’état du stock afin de pouvoir assurer le réapprovisionnement des pièces,
Reporter toutes les interventions sur un outil de Gestion de Maintenance Assisté par Ordinateur (GMAO)


Travail posté, en semaine et/ou mardi au samedi sur une base 35h hebdomadaire.

Bien entendu, cette description n’est pas limitative.

What we offer:


Design of the controls aspects of material handling systems for Dematic Enhancement projects, to a given specification, within cost and time scale constraints, and to the customers’ requirements


To develop, implement and support hardware / software solutions for Modernisation and Upgrade projects
To provide a complete controls design solution for a material handling project including electrical design, software design and commissioning – whilst ensuring the solution meets the requirements of the project and carried out within cost and time scale constraints
To maintain Dematic’s image as a top quality, professional company, by adopting an honest, professional and attentive approach
To understand the constraints of working on live sites and provide solutions that minimise the disruptions to client operations whilst working within the project scope
To provide support, attend to system faults and perform investigation and fault rectification where necessary
To perform site supervisory duties on controls projects when required
To support the sales team with controls costings and design concepts and recommending spare parts


Tasks and Qualifications:


Educated to a minimum of HNC/HND in Electrical Engineering or related discipline
Hands-on experience working in a similar role, including controls design and commissioning within an automation-based industry, ideally within the automated warehouse industry
Previous use of CAD tools, (AutoCAD, EPLAN)
Advanced understanding of PLCs (Siemens or Allen Bradley)
Advanced understanding of fieldbus systems and I/O equipment, e.g., Profibus, Profinet, ASi, TCP/IP
Advanced understanding of other controls automation related equipment, e.g. Bar code scanners, HMIs, Variable frequency drives
Working knowledge of relevant standards governing the controls automation industry
Working knowledge of the Machinery Directive and the measures needed for compliance


To be conversant Word, Excel, Project, Outlook.

Wir suchen einen indirekten Einkäufer (m/w/d), der alle indirekten Ausgaben und Kosten für Materialien und Dienstleistungen innerhalb bestimmter Standorte und Kategorien unterstützt. Der/die indirekte Einkäufer/in wird für die Beantwortung aller Anfragen unserer Standorte in der DACH-Region verantwortlich sein und daran arbeiten, lokalisierte Strategien für die wichtigsten lokalen Kategorien und Unterkategorien zu entwickeln, die ihnen zugewiesen sind. In dieser Funktion arbeitest du eng mit der Kategorie- und Beschaffungsabteilung der EMEA zusammen, um die Bedürfnisse der britischen Organisation umfassend zu unterstützen und standardisierte Prozesse für die Zukunft zu entwickeln.


Für diese Position suchen wir einen erfahrenen Einkäufer:in mit Erfahrung in ähnlichen Bereichen (Fertigung, Automobil, Luft- und Raumfahrt oder Maschinenbau), der mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammenarbeiten und Kosteneinsparungen im gesamten Unternehmen vorantreiben kann. Die Position wird in unserer Zentrale in Heusenstamm angesiedelt sein und bietet flexible, hybride Arbeitsmöglichkeiten.


What we offer:


Life At Dematic:


Seit über 200 Jahren ist Dematic ein führender Anbieter von integrierter automatisierter Technologie, Software und Dienstleistungen zur Optimierung der Lieferkette. Dematic beschäftigt über 10.000 qualifizierte Logistikexperten, um seine Kunden weltweit zu bedienen, mit Entwicklungszentren und Produktionsstätten auf der ganzen Welt. Dematic ist eine Marke der KION Group und hat mehr als 6.000 integrierte Systeme für einen Kundenstamm implementiert, der kleine, mittlere und große Unternehmen in einer Vielzahl von Marktsektoren umfasst.


Tasks and Qualifications:


Deine Verantwortlichkeit: 


Verantwortlich für die zugewiesenen indirekten Beschaffungsausgaben und die entsprechende Lieferantenbasis für unsere Standorte in der DACH-Region.
Vorbereitung und Durchführung von RFP's / RFQ's, Prüfung der eingereichten Angebote, Erstellung von Preisspiegeln, Präsentation von Beschaffungsempfehlungen, Abschluss von Verträgen und entsprechende Bestellungen.
Definition und Umsetzung der lokalen Kategorie-/Subkategoriestrategie für die zugewiesenen Standorte und Abstimmung mit dem EMEA Category Procurement Team sowie den internen Stakeholdern.
Überprüfung der Lieferantenbasis, Definition einer robusten bevorzugten Lieferantenbasis, Reduzierung der Anzahl der Lieferanten und entsprechende Bündelung des Geschäfts.
Verfolgung der Gesamtziele für Einsparungen und Kostenvermeidung in der indirekten Beschaffung, regelmäßiges Benchmarking der verantwortlichen Ausgaben, Identifizierung von Potenzialen, Führung von Lieferantenverhandlungen und entsprechende Umsetzung der Potenziale.
Berichterstattung über Kosteneinsparungspotenziale und -erfolge sowie Kostenvermeidung unter Verwendung der etablierten Beschaffungsvorlagen und -instrumente.
Analysieren von Einkaufsdaten, Sicherstellen von Datentransparenz und hoher Datenqualität in allen vom KION Einkauf genutzten Systemen (z.B. SAP)
Verbesserung und Umsetzung der Standardisierung für die zugewiesenen Standorte (Standarddokumente, gemeinsame Dienstleistungen und Waren) und Sicherstellung einer engen Abstimmung mit dem Category Procurement EMEA.
Vertragsmanagement, Sicherstellung der Transparenz aller Verträge, regelmäßige Überprüfung der Bedingungen und Gültigkeiten.
Kontinuierliche Verbesserung der vorhandenen Verfahren und Systeme in Bezug auf den indirekten Einkauf.


Qualifikationen und Erfahrung:


Abgeschlossenes Studium der Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder einer anderen beschaffungsbezogenen Disziplin.
3-4 Jahre Erfahrung in der Automobilindustrie (bevorzugt) oder einer anderen Fertigungsindustrie, in der der Kandidat Einkaufstätigkeiten im Team für indirekte Standortbeschaffung oder Kategoriebeschaffung durchgeführt hat.
Erfahrung in der Arbeit in funktionsübergreifenden Teams und in einem internationalen Umfeld.
Teilnahme an und Durchführung von Verhandlungsprojekten (Erfahrung mit Verhandlungen und Vertragsmanagement mit internationalen und lokalen Lieferanten), bei denen Kosteneinsparungen erzielt wurden und bei denen starke Einkaufsfähigkeiten (Fähigkeit zur Analyse komplexer Daten und Entwicklung von Strategien) unter Beweis gestellt wurden.
Ausgezeichnetes Stakeholder-Management, Präsentationsfähigkeiten, gute Organisation und die Fähigkeit, Prioritäten zu setzen. 
Hohe persönliche Motivation und die Fähigkeit, praktische oder innovative alternative Ansätze zur Erreichung von Zielen zu entwickeln.
Hohe analytische Fähigkeiten und die Bereitschaft, Ergebnisse in einem Team zu erzielen.
Selbstmotiviert, unabhängig, ergebnisorientiert, enthusiastisch, engagiert, teamfähig und ein guter Zuhörer und Beobachter
Fließend in Deutsch und Englisch


Dematic ist stolz darauf, allen Mitarbeitern und Bewerbern gleiche Beschäftigungschancen zu bieten. Dematic verbietet Diskriminierung und Belästigung jeglicher Art, ungeachtet der Rasse, der Religion oder der Weltanschauung, des Alters, des Geschlechts, der nationalen oder ethnischen Herkunft, einer Behinderung, der sexuellen Orientierung, der Geschlechtsidentität oder anderer durch Bundes-, Landes- oder lokale Gesetze geschützter Merkmale. Diese Richtlinie gilt für alle Beschäftigungsbedingungen, einschließlich Rekrutierung, Einstellung, Vermittlung, Beförderung, Kündigung, Entlassung, Rückruf, Versetzung, Beurlaubung, Vergütung und Schulung.

Votre rôle : Au sein d'une équipe soudée et humaine, voici les missions qui vous seront confiées : - Support aux équipes de développement (revue de code, formations). - Installation et maintenance des socles techniques sur les architectures clientes. - Construire des outils techniques permettant de mesurer et d’améliorer les performances de notre logiciel standard. - Etre l’interlocuteur privilégié avec le servide de R&D (en Allemagne) de notre logiciel standard. - Assurer des astreintes pour les sites en production.


What we offer:


Career Development


We are here to support you for the entirety of your Dematic career. From a fast start of learning Dematic’s history and foundational training to succeed in your role to leadership development programs, technical training and certifications, and Career Navigator to identify challenging new opportunities, our goal is to help you grow beyond your borders.


Competitive Compensation And Benefits


Our attractive and market competitive total rewards packages are designed to reward high performance and to assist in managing your personal and family needs. Dematic offers robust packages based on employment status and national requirements.


Pay Transparency


Dematic is committed to pay transparency. As such, Dematic will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.


However, Dematic will still maintain confidentiality of your pay information. Employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by Dematic, or (c) consistent with Dematic’s legal duty to furnish information.


Global Opportunities


As a global company, our employees are exposed to different ideas and perspectives from around the world. We offer international assignments for qualified employees and wherever possible, we offer flexible working hours and modern workspace design.


Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/

Bon niveau d'anglais requis (Italien Espagnol ou Allemand serait un plus indéniable).
Notions de gestion de projets.

We are actively seeking a Resident Maintenance Technician to join us at a dedicated customer site in Lakeside. The position will form part of a two-person team responsible for maintaining and repairing state-of-the-art Dematic installed automation equipment at the customer’s micro fulfillment center.

Reporting to the Regional Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for maintaining, repairing, and supporting the automated materials picking and handling system installed at the site. This is an exciting opportunity to work with the very latest technology in the industry and help us on our journey to provide an exceptional service to an ever-growing customer.

When you join our team, you will be empowered to think big and take charge of your career; allowing you to shape your future as you tackle some of the toughest technical and logistical challenges around. We need your tech-savvy and innovative approach to help us continue to transform the industry with world-class, leading-edge solutions.

What we offer:

Career Development

Competitive Compensation And Benefits
Pay Transparency

Global Opportunities

Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/

Tasks and Qualifications:

Key Responsibilities:

Carry out automated material handling and equipment servicing in accordance with the quality standards and time schedules as set out in the equipment manuals
To undertake scheduled repairs in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations and industry standard practices
Diagnosis of Mechanical / Electrical / Electronic / PLC / PC faults and subsequent repairs
To comply with Health & Safety legislation at all times
To ensure the quality of output at all times
To accurately record all work undertaken
Involvement in continuous improvement and sales opportunities
To ensure on-site spares are kept to optimum levels
To represent the company in a professional manner at all times and maintain customer relations
To adhere to the Quality processes and procedures as set out by the company


Qualifications & Experience:

ONC or equivalent qualification in Electrical / Mechanical Engineering
Preferably a recognised engineering apprenticeship 
A working understanding of Mechanical, Electrical & Electronic technical manuals & drawings
Basic understanding of control systems and techniques
Basic understanding of PLC equipment
Experience working at height
Previous experience in working with various conveyor systems
IT literacy
Understanding of planned preventive maintenance (PPM) schedules
Working knowledge of FEM and BS standards governing the automated warehouse industry would be desirable but not essential

We, Dematic, are a leading global provider of logistics automation and, as a system integrator, supply the entire range of services. This includes the planning, realization, implementation and support of automated system solutions for warehouses, distribution centers and production facilities. Process improvements, material flow automation and performance optimization software form the components of each solution.


With over 10,000 employees worldwide, we generate sales of approximately 1.6 billion euros. Our headquarters are in the USA in Atlanta, Georgia. Customers around the globe rely on high-end warehouse automation systems from Dematic. With 60 engineering centers in 25 countries worldwide and production facilities in North America, Europe, China and Australia, we are a partner for renowned customers in the field of automated warehouse logistics.


What we offer:


What to expect:


As an ABAP Developer you will contribute to our national and international customer projects and advise our SAP consultants regarding technical issues. Together with your team you will develop sophisticated solution concepts and implement them using ABAP4/ABAP-00. You will be responsible for all necessary tests as well as interface analysis and develop project requirements in close cooperation with related project departments. Documentation and preparation of training documents as well as the execution of trainings complete your tasks with us.


Tasks and Qualifications:


Your tasks in detail:


Collaboration in challenging SAP projects as well as support of SAP consultants regarding technical issues
Development of solution concepts and their implementation using ABAP4/ABAP-00
Taking over all necessary tests as well as interface analysis and development in close cooperation with the specialist departments
Connection of subsystems and hardware such as RF handhelds to ITS-Mobile
Documentation and preparation of training documents as well as the execution of trainings


Your strengths:


A degree in computer science, mathematics or a comparable education
Programming experience in SAP ABAP-00 / ABAP4 or a comparable programming language
Ideally experience in the area of SAP EWM /WM modules
Understanding of intra-logistic processes and systems or the interest to get familiar with them
Fluent written and spoken English
At least German B2 and willingness to continue learning German
Willingness to travel approx. 25% mainly within Europe


Your advantages & benefits: 


flexible working hours 
Home office option 
Performance-related remuneration according to IG Metall 
Innovative and successful team

Job Title: Mobile Multi Skilled Engineer - Controls Bias
Description:
Description
Dematic has an excellent opportunity for a Mobile Multi-Skilled Engineer to join our engineering team on a permanent basis. The role forms part of a wider mobile engineering team who are collectively responsible for undertaking and providing breakdown cover for Dematic installed equipment across various customer sites in the UK.

The position will also support the occasional scheduled service work with a distinct focus on control systems including Siemens S7 along with distributed control systems, drives and scanners. We are seeking those with a bias in controls but also a multi-skilled engineering background in mechanical and electrical-related disciplines.

Due to the mobile nature of the position, you will be travelling out to various customer sites across the UK on a regular basis and providing call-out support for emergency breakdowns. To support this, we provide a company van in addition to all the tools and equipment required to carry out the role.

What we offer:

Career Development
Competitive Compensation and Benefits
Pay Transparency
Global Opportunities


Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/

Tasks and Qualifications:

Key Responsibilities: 

To undertake scheduled repairs in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations and industry standard practices
To undertake emergency repairs in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations and industry standard practices
To undertake occasional scheduled service work in accordance with the standards set out in the relevant manufacturer’s equipment manual.
To accurately record all work undertaken
To provide a 24hr x 7day emergency on-call service as required
To comply with Health & Safety legislation at all times
To ensure the quality of output at all times
To represent the company in a professional manner at all times
To ensure the correct equipment/tools are carried to undertake the role
To adhere to the Quality processes and procedures as set out by the company.
To identify continuous improvement and sales opportunities


Qualifications & Experience:

Ideally 5 years of experience within the warehouse automated industry. However, we will also consider those from related engineering environments such as Aerospace, Automotive, FMCG and Manufacturing.
Minimum HNC / HND (or equivalent) qualification in electrical/electronic discipline.
Good understanding of control systems and techniques especially Siemens S7 along with Distributed Control Systems/Drives and Scanners.
LEEA Part 1 is desirable.
Working knowledge of LOLER regulations.
Working knowledge of FEM and BS standards governing the automated warehouse industry.
Full UK Driving Licence due to the travel requirements of the position.

What we offer:


We are seeking an experienced developer who is passionate about developing high-quality software solutions using the agile methodology. You will be responsible for developing software that meets the needs of the customer and aligns with the agile principles and practices. You will work closely with the Product Owner, Scrum Master, and other roles in the SAFe agile framework to deliver value to the customer.


International travel will be necessary every few months to facilitate quarterly planning and foster relationships with teams from diverse backgrounds.


Tasks and Qualifications:


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Develop software solutions that meet the needs of the customer and align with the SAFe principles and practices.
Work with the Product Owner to understand the requirements and priorities of the product backlog.
Collaborate with other Developers and team members to design and implement software features.
Mentoring junior team members.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
Perform unit testing and ensure that the software meets the quality standards.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-up meetings, sprint review, and sprint retrospective.
Work with the Scrum Master to identify and remove impediments that are preventing the team from reaching their goals.
Continuously learn and stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, best practices, and industry trends.


Qualifications:


Required Qualifications:


Minimum of 10 years of experience in software development.
Strong programming skills in at least one programming language, such as Java, C++, or Python.
Experience with Java microservice frameworks like Spring Boot, Quarkus, etc.
Experience with web development technologies, such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
Strong communication and collaboration skills. Fluent in English.


Preferred Qualification:


Experience working with REST APIs and NoSQL databases (MongoDB a plus)
Experience with version control tools, such as Git.
Experience with Agile methodologies


Education:


Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field; MSc/MA is a plus


Supervisor Responsibilities:


None

Are you ready to embark on an exciting professional journey? Here's your chance to become a pivotal part of our EMEA team as a Human Resources Business Partner, leading UK&I regions.


As the driving force behind HR market dynamics, you will thrive on adaptability and functional collaboration, seamlessly translating business priorities into swift action. You will be responsible to lead the UK HR agenda and culture in support of our value proposition. You will support sustainable growth, acting as a trusted advisor internally and caring for the diverse population in the UK, keeping the necessary skill-sets contemporary with market evolution, leading in compliance with UK labour law requirements.


If you are eager to make an indelible mark on the future of HR in the UK&I regions, we invite you to apply and join us in this exciting journey.


What we offer:


Career Development
Competitive Compensation and Benefits
Pay Transparency
Global Opportunities

Life At Dematic:


For over 200 years, Dematic has been a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software, and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 10,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium, and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.


Tasks and Qualifications:


You will be responsible for:


Lead the EMEA people agenda for the UK & Ireland market (approx. 700 employees), ensuring alignment with Global matrix functions and parent company and acting as trusted advisor and partner to the Local Leadership team and member of the EMEA HR Leadership Team.
Implement functional/global strategies and help guide critical talent decisions incl. workforce/succession planning, talent development and performance management to support company growth.
Partner with and coach leaders to develop an inclusive and high-performing culture, enabling a win attitude and a continuous improvement approach to business.
Use analytics to enable business leaders to make decisions faster and based on data, by identifying trends, considering stakeholders’ views, recommending solutions to improve performance, speed, retention, and employee engagement.
Provide oversight and direction in the handling of complex employee relations matters, ensuring compliance with all applicable employment laws and regulations.
Build leadership and management capability to facilitate an open and inclusive environment, focused on priorities and delivering on customer outcomes.
Champion initiatives that support the success of the organisations growth and reinforce a collaborative, aligned and engaged culture.
Lead, develop and support the UK HR Team (Direct and Indirect reports) to create a high performing, respected and engaged HR Team.


About you:


Directly applicable Human Resource Leadership experience in engineering/technology company.
Experience in complex, multicultural, global organization preferred.
Demonstrated understanding and application of Human Resources areas including Talent Development, Succession Planning, Employee Relations, Employee Engagement, Organizational Design, Compensation, Talent Acquisition, Diversity and Inclusion, and Change Management.
Demonstrated ability to build credibility and confidence with a wide variety of stakeholders as a trusted advisor.
Highly collaborative with strong consultative, analytical, time management, and project management skills.
Exceptional customer focus and ability to deliver results.
Unquestioned integrity with assertiveness, presence, and confidence.
Excellent influencing skills at all levels in the organization and competence in making timely, effective, data-based decisions.
Experience developing and motivating a multi-functional team, as well as leading through organizational and behavioural change.
Exceptional English language skills, both written and verbal, at all levels.

What we offer:


Technicien de maintenance


Tasks and Qualifications:


Technicien de maintenance

What we offer:


Votre rôle :


Au sein d'une équipe de 15 personnes opérationnelles le rôle du Technicien de maintenance est d'assurer la maintenance préventive et corrective des process de notre client à Wattrelos (59).


Vos missions sont les suivantes :


Garantir des interventions curatives et préventives sur une installation logistique en respectant les consignes de sécurité,
Diagnostiquer l’origine d’une panne, grâce à vos connaissances et à l’utilisation de l’ensemble des moyens mis à disposition pour réduire les temps d’arrêts,
Reporter l’analyse de la panne et pouvoir être acteur d’évolution afin de garantir et pérenniser la disponibilité des installations de notre client,
Réaliser les interventions préventives en suivant le plan de maintenance,
Assurer la sortie des pièces détachées nécessaire à la bonne réalisation de l’intervention,
Reporter l’état du stock afin de pouvoir assurer le réapprovisionnement des pièces,
Reporter toutes les interventions sur un outil de Gestion de Maintenance Assisté par Ordinateur (GMAO)


Travail posté, de jour ou de nuit, en semaine et/ou week-end sur une base 35h hebdomadaire.


Bien entendu, cette description n’est pas limitative.


Tasks and Qualifications:


Votre profil :


Idéalement, vous avez une formation technique d’électromécanicien et/ou d'automaticien (BAC + 2 SIRA).


Ce poste est ouvert aux personnes n'ayant pas encore d'expérience.


Vos atouts :


Vous êtes quelqu’un d’autonome et serez force de proposition dans votre équipe.
Vous êtes à l'aise avec l'informatique (WMS, WCS), idéalement.
Vous maîtrisez l’outil informatique MS Office.
La disposition du permis de conduire serait un plus, des déplacements exceptionnels pourront être demandés.


Nous vous offrons :


Un poste en CDI à temps plein
Une participation aux activités culturelles ou sportives, des chèques vacances, des chèques cadeaux
Un accompagnement pour vos formations professionnelles
Un Plan Epargne Entreprise (PEE) et un Plan Epargne pour la Retraite Collectif (PERCO)
Un parcours d’intégration personnalisé


Si vous vous reconnaissez dans ce poste, rejoignez-nous !

Tasks and Qualifications:


What You Will Do In This Role


Repair and maintenance of Material Handling Equipment (MHE) including belt tracking, component adjustment/replacement, component lubrication, etc. 
Completes preventative maintenance routines, documentation, and procedures. 
Use electrical test equipment to troubleshoot electrical circuitry. 
Create and close work orders into asset management system with appropriate data to include labor hours, equipment maintenance, and parts used.

What We Are Looking For


High School diploma or equivalent required. Typically, an Associate’s degree or vocational technical training preferred. Specialized skill training/certification preferred. 
Demonstrates a senior-level knowledge of 5-7 years of experience in a technical or specialty area. 
Proven experience in area of responsibility and successful demonstration of position and key tasks as presented above. 
Ability to be customer facing while maintaining professional communications through email and in person conversations with onsite customer leadership, Dematic leadership, and technicians. 
Responsible for leading projects, teams, and directing day to day operations and tasks to onsite maintenance team. 
Able to lift and move material up to 50 pounds each 
Regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head 
Occasionally push and pull wheeled dollies loaded with products up to 100 pounds 
Able to climb ladders and gangways safely and without limitation

Tasks and Qualifications:

Dematic is a global leader providing a comprehensive range of intelligent intralogistics and materials handling solutions. With a global knowledge network of more than 6,000 highly skilled logistics professionals, Dematic is able to provide its customers a unique perspective in world-class materials handling solution design.

Our tremendous track record of success has led to the development and implementation of more than 4,500 world-class integrated systems for a customer base including some of the world's biggest companies. Our employees at Dematic work in an international network of experts where the willingness to cooperate and exchange knowledge is crucial to commercial success.

Warehousing and logistics systems play an increasingly critical role in contributing to the competitiveness of many companies and, at the same time, to the effectiveness of the general world economy. The modern intra-logistics solutions combine state-of-the-art mechatronics, complex software, advanced robotics, modern computational perception, and sophisticated AI and operations research algorithms to provide high throughput and efficient processing for many mission-critical commercial logistics applications.

Dematic is looking for dynamic, hands-on, innovation-minded engineers to join our autonomous vehicles software team. An ideal candidate should have a good understanding of the technologies related to Automated Guided Vehicles (AGV), Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMR), and Fleet Management Systems. Our goal is to deliver a robust software solution utilizing state-of-the-art technologies and algorithms to enable the safe and efficient operation of AMRs inside the warehouse.

This is What You Will do in This Role: 

 Design, develop and test software for autonomous robots that collaboratively accomplish warehouse automation and material flow tasks.
 Develop software for the Robotic Control System and fleet manager who is responsible for optimizing work assignments, AMR fleet movements, and energy management
 Apply Modern AI and machine learning methodologies to solve complex robotics problems involving the synthesis of solutions that can measurably streamline the operations of fleets and swarms of robots.
 Build visualization tools for analyzing and debugging robot behavior
 Collaborate in design and code reviews with other team members.


What We are Looking For:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar, or equivalent experience
 3-8 years of software development experience and agile development methodologies.
 Demonstrated ability to program in one or more high-level languages (e.g. C++, Java, Python, C#).
 Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team
 Good communication skills, both written and verbal
 Ability to Travel up to 15% over the year
 Experience with software development on robotic platforms - ideally with autonomous mobile robots (AGV/AMR).
 Experience working with logistics or industrial automation
 Experience in technologies such as mapping, localization, path planning, SLAM, mobile robot navigation, 2-dimensional path planning, obstacle avoidance, controls, energy management

Dematic is seeking a Senior Tax Technologist, focused on US and Canadian tax technology integration and automation. Job Summary:

We are seeking an experienced developer who is passionate about developing high-quality software solutions using the agile methodology. You will be responsible for developing software that meets the needs of the customer and aligns with the agile principles and practices. You will work closely with the Product Owner, Scrum Master, and other roles in the SAFe agile framework to deliver value to the customer.


This is What You Will do in This Role: 

Develop software solutions that meet the needs of the customer and align with the SAFe principles and practices.
Work with the Product Owner to understand the requirements and priorities of the product backlog.
Collaborate with other Developers and team members to design and implement software features.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
Perform unit testing and ensure that the software meets the quality standards.
Participate in Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-up meetings, sprint review, and sprint retrospective.
Work with the Scrum Master to identify and remove impediments that are preventing the team from reaching their goals.
Continuously learn and stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, best practices, and industry trends.

Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college.

Strong programming skills in at least one programming language, such as Java, C++, or Python.
Experience with web development technologies, such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
Strong communication and collaboration skills. Fluent in English.

Experience working with REST APIs and NoSQL databases (MongoDB a plus)

Experience with Agile methodologies

We are Dematic



Dematic is an intralogistics innovator that designs, builds and supports intelligent, automated solutions for manufacturing, warehouse and distribution environments for customers that are powering the future of commerce. With engineering centers, manufacturing facilities and service centers located in more than 25 countries, the Dematic global network of 10,000 employees has helped achieve more than 6,000 worldwide customer installations for some of the world’s leading brands. Headquartered in Atlanta, Dematic is a member of KION Group, one of the global leaders in industrial trucks and supply chain solutions, and a leading provider of warehouse automation.

Assisting product and technical engineers in developing solutions.
Create high quality software as part of a cross-discipline project team.
Programming utilizing accepted software coding standards and tools.

Supports Application Engineering & Sales
High level design, capacity & configuration requirements.
Interface-level design including screen layouts, messaging and communications.
System-level design describing implementation details of the on-board control system.

Basic qualifications



University degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.
4-8 years of software development experience.

Experience with motion controls for robotics systems
