Experience with real-time operating systems
CMAKE, GCC
Experience in software tools for robotics solutions: ROS, Gazebo, Python

Job Title: Assistenz (w/m/d) für KION Strategy & Solutions Consulting
Description:
Wir suchen Sie als Assistenz (w/m/d) für den Konzernbereich Strategie und Solutions Consulting in unserem Headquarter in Frankfurt am Main (Flughafen/Gateway Gardens).

What we offer:

Ein Unternehmen mit Zukunft: Schon heute beschäftigen wir als börsennotiertes M-Dax Unternehmen mehr als 41.000 MitarbeiterInnen in über 100 Ländern und treiben damit maßgeblich die Zukunft der Intralogistik voran 
Gemeinsam vorankommen: Standardisierter und dokumentierter Feedbackprozess mit internationalen Karrieremöglichkeiten und individuellen Entwicklungsangeboten 
Lebendige Community: Regelmäßige Firmenevents und fachbezogene Workshopformate mit Möglichkeiten zur internen Vernetzung 
Individuelle Benefits: Modernste IT-Ausstattung & Mobile Devices, kostenloses Deutschlandticket, Möglichkeit zum Leasen eines Dienstrads, kostenloses Obst & Getränke im Büro & Corporate Benefits
Unsere Basics: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Teilzeitmodelle, Möglichkeit zum regelmäßigen Mobilen Arbeiten, attraktives Vergütungspaket, Arbeitgeberfinanzierte betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Möglichkeit zur Entgeltumwandlung mit Arbeitgeberzuschuss


Tasks and Qualifications:

Sie arbeiten eng mit dem Bereichsleiter für Konzernstrategie, Commercial Strategy und Market Intelligence (Executive Vice President KION Strategy & Solutions Consulting) im Tagesgeschäft, in ausgewählten Projekten und in allen administrativen und organisatorischen Angelegenheiten zusammen
Sie wirken bei der Koordination, Organisation, Vor- und Nachbereitung von Meetings aktiv mit
Sie unterstützen eigenständig bei weiterführenden Projektaufgaben, z.B. Einfordern, Zusammenstellen, Strukturieren und Hinterfragen von Analyse
Sie erstellen Präsentationen in deutscher und englischer Sprache
Sie unterstützen auch die Mitarbeiter der Abteilung bei der Koordinierung ausgewählter Termine und Reiseorganisation
Sie arbeiten eng mit den Kolleginnen und Kollegen der anderen Bereichsleiter- und Vorstandssekretariate und mit den Kolleginnen und Kollegen der Fachabteilungen zusammen


Ihr Profil

Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich absolviertes Studium oder eine abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung mit einer Weiterbildung zum Fach- oder Betriebswirt sowie mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Rolle, zum Beispiel auf Vorstandsebene
Sie kommunizieren sicher in deutscher und englischer Sprache und sind in der Lage sich eigeninitiativ ein starkes Netzwerk innerhalb und außerhalb der Organisation aufzubauen
Sie zeichnet ein organisierter Arbeitsstil aus und Sie sind in der Lage, Aufgabenstellungen und Themen sehr gut zu priorisieren
Sie kommunizieren auf verschiedenen Ebenen sicher und zielgruppenorientiert und verfügen über ein hohes Maß an Belastbarkeit und Durchsetzungsfähigkeit
Sie zeigen bei der Arbeit ein außerordentlich hohes Maß an Engagement, Diskretion und Loyalität


Kontakt

Wenn Sie diese interessante und vielseitige Aufgabe reizt, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung. Ihre Ansprechpartnerin ist Monika Wohlfarth, Tel. +49 (0) 69 20110 7663.

Tasks and Qualifications:


What You Will Do In This Role


Repair and maintenance of Material Handling Equipment (MHE) including belt tracking, component adjustment/replacement, component lubrication, etc.
Completes preventative maintenance routines, documentation, and procedures.
Use electrical test equipment to troubleshoot electrical circuitry.
Create and close work orders into asset management system with appropriate data to include labor hours, equipment maintenance, and parts used.
Troubleshoot conveyance problems and understand resources needed to resolve them.
Locate and track spare parts from inventory.
Performs complex maintenance and equipment testing to ensure they meet specifications.
Provides assistance with training customers to operate equipment.
Respond to service calls and correct equipment failures and faults.

High School diploma or equivalent required. Typically, an Associate degree or vocational technical training preferred. Specialized skill training/certification preferred.
Demonstrates a senior-level knowledge of a technical or specialty area.
Proven experience in area of responsibility and successful demonstration of position and key tasks as presented above.
Ability to be customer facing while maintaining professional communications through email and in person conversations with onsite customer leadership, Dematic leadership, and technicians.
Responsible for leading projects, teams, and directing day to day operations and tasks to onsite maintenance team.
Able to lift and move material up to 50 pounds each
Regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head
Occasionally push and pull wheeled dollies loaded with products up to 100 pounds
Able to climb ladders and gangways safely and without limitation
Working conditions may include small spaces, dust, fumes/odors, hot/cold temperatures, inside/outside noise, vibration, standing on concrete for long hours, and wet or uneven surfaces.

Job Title: Senior Controls Software Engineer (PLC)(Grand Rapids or Atlanta)
Description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced engineer to join our Controls Software group. The successful candidate will work closely with a team of experts to design, develop, and maintain our automatic palletizer system, ensuring it operates efficiently and effectively. In addition, the candidate will collaborate with other teams to support the integration of our global conveyor code.

Tasks and Qualifications:


This role resides within Dematic’s Global Software R&D organization. State of the art controls software is at the heart of our sophisticated material handling solutions. This is a key technical Controls R&D development role that will help accelerate the adoption of next generation technologies and improvements across our products. This is an exciting opportunity to join Dematic. If you are passionate about leading change and creating the future in a rapidly growing industry this role is for you!


We are seeking a talented and experienced engineer to join our Controls Software group. The successful candidate will work closely with a team of experts to design, develop, and maintain our automatic palletizer system, ensuring it operates efficiently and effectively. In addition, the candidate will collaborate with other teams to support the integration of our global conveyor code.


If you are a talented engineer with a passion for automation, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. This is a full-time position with competitive compensation and benefits packages. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.


This is What You Will do in This Role: 


Design, develop and maintain our automatic palletizer system.
Develop and execute system test plans to ensure the system meets requirements and specifications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software developers, hardware engineers, and control system engineers to ensure seamless integration of the parallelizing system.
Work with other teams to support the integration of our global conveyor code.
Perform system optimization, including algorithm development and software tuning.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for system issues.
Keep up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies related to automated parallelizing systems and provide recommendations for future improvements.
Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.


What We are Looking For:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical, Mechanical, Computer Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering, Control Systems, or Robotics & Automation.
At least 3 years of experience of in PLC programming, specifically for Siemens and/or Allen-Bradley is required.
Strong understanding of control system design and optimization.
Knowledge of industrial control systems, PLCs, and robotics.
Experience in programming languages such as C++, Python, or Java is required.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

#In-post

As customers grapple with the challenges of e-commerce fulfillment with ever increasing need to handle more volume, variety and variation with ever decreasing delivery time expectations, Dematic’s growth directly depends on bringing the next generation of intelligent supply chain solutions to market. These solutions include flexible order fulfillment, warehouse management systems, warehouse and supply chain execution systems, and supply chain optimization. These solutions employ cloud-native and AI / ML technologies, and work with a blend of fixed and mobile automation (e.g., autonomous mobile robots). A key strategy for Dematic to deliver on these growth priorities is to create a Big Data Platform that will support operational analytics, process optimization, training of Machine Learning models and other differentiating features for Dematic customers. This position is within the Dematic Software R&D team and will provide technical and architectural leadership to define and implement the Big Data Platform.

Tasks and Qualifications:


This is What You Will do in This Role: 


Design and develop the overall big data architecture, ensuring it aligns with the company's strategic objectives and business requirements.
Lead all data platform initiatives: Data Lake Strategy, Data Governance, Data Security and Compliance, Data Platform Cloud Infrastructure, MLOps and Master Data Management.
Develop data models and data integration patterns for various data sources, enabling seamless data flow across the enterprise.
Provide technical leadership and guidance to the development team, ensuring best practices and standards are followed in big data projects.


What We are Looking For:


5+ years of industry experience architecting and designing holistic Big Data Platforms
Expertise in Big Data Platform architecture with a focus on scalability, performance, and cost to serve.
Expert level hand-on experience in cloud technologies in GCP, AWS or Azure (preferably GCP)
Strong proficiency in modern Big Data Technologies such as Apache Beam, Spark/Databricks, Kafka, NATS, MongoDB/Atlas, Apache Airflow, Apache Flink.
Hands-on experience in architecting and designing solutions using Big Data table formats like Apache Iceberg, Apache Druid or Apache Delta Lake
Proficient in setting up and defining observability tools and metrics, including Grafana, Splunk, Datadog.
Expert level understanding and experience designing cloud Data models.
Working knowledge of Python, Java, Pyspark, Airflow.
Expertise in enterprise data management policies and principles with a focus on data lineage and data cataloging strategy
Deep expertise of architectural patterns for real-time and batch data processing at large scale.
Ability to draft proposals of cost vs. use/benefit of proposed architectural changes.
Expert level understanding and use of software and data engineering design principles and best practices
Understanding of modern SDLC processes (Agile, CI, CD, etc.) and how architecture fits
The ability to think strategically and align design and architecture patterns to drive current needs as well as future growth
The ability to tailor technical communications to any level (Exec to Jr. Software Engineers)
Bachelor’s degree in business, Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or equivalent.


What Will Set You Apart :


Deep understanding and experience architecting and deigning cloud-based solutions and processes leveraging data mesh and hub-and-spoke patterns. 
Prior experience working as an enterprise data architect, architecting data solutions at an enterprise level considering the current and future needs of the organization into perspective.
